Review Text: This stand is awfully bulky it almost seems like a stand for kids designed by a kid - either that or an engineer with the challenge of taking so much plastic and designing something as strong as possible, yet at the same time it sfeels like if you open or close it enough times it will eventually break. When folded, it is taller than my iPad stacked onto my Surface Pro with my Kindle on top - close to an inch tall.Pros:-afforable-flexible-decent padding to prevent scratches and keep the stand from slippingCons:-bulky (won't fit in your pocket)-weak feeling hinges take some force to open, and you wonder if you will break them-100 % plastic - no metal except for the screws that hold the hinges togetherBut for $8.99 I guess you get what you pay for.....it's just going in my traveling bag.

Name: Mike Mitchell
Review Text: This is such a simple device, but it worked perfectly. The plastic has a solid feel to it but is still light (making it perfect to tuck in your luggage or laptop case). I used it to hold a 15-inch portable monitor, and it worked perfectly. It also supported my 10-inch tablet. I think this is a really solid item for a fantastic price. I'm probably going to buy another one for my wife so she can watch Netflix on her tablet during lunch at work.

Name: Ryan
Review Title: Cheap and Easy but with a Flaw.
Review Text: Canâ€™t plug in a charger if using in portrait mode. Not enough clearance between the surface itâ€™s sitting on and the charger port to fit the charger. (See attached picture). Only using the iPad in landscape orientation (sideways) allows for charging. Small, portable, cheap and easy. Folds up for easy portability. Plastic construction and might not last forever if you plan to open/close it a lot. Does the job but nothing special and not perfect I.e the charging issue.

Name: K B
Review Text: Clever design. Can handle phone or tablet by changing its configuration.Also, it's grippy on the bottom and where the back of the device rests on and the grooves it fits into. Device won't wiggle around or budge if you are putting pressure anywhere on the surface.It's perfect for flat surfaces or semi-flat surfaces like couches and beds. Doesn't work great if I try to balance it on my stomach. Oh well, can't have it all.

Name: HarleyGirl
Review Title: I was surprised at how strong and versatile!
Review Text: I had my doubts, I really did, as to whether this would be another flimsy one. Iâ€™ve bought a similar type before and I was disappointed and definitely wouldnâ€™t trust it to hold anything larger than my phone. This one is surprisingly sturdy and has no problem with eith my iPad or with my Kindle Fire 10 HD- in either orientation. It folds up easily into a compact, very transportable size that I can stuff in a purse - or pocket, I guess if I had to!It was a smart buy. Inexpensive, sturdy, and does what it says it well.

Name: Patrick Ackerman
Review Text: I bought this for my Samsung tablet a, which I use frequently in the portrait position. By using this stand I was able to buy a lightweight case for the tablet without sacrificing the need to use it in the portrait position. This is a very compact but sturdy stand. It is easy to carry from place to place and folds up into a very small space. Obviously it is lightweight plastic so I'm not expecting it to last forever oh, but I have been very happy that I can put the Samsung Galaxy tablet a, even with the case on, into this stand and it is very sturdy. I'm not sure how I would describe security features as this doesn't really apply to this item. I would recommend this item and I would buy again.

Name: darrell schliepp
Review Text: Stand works with my 10inch tablet and my much smaller phone. Everything seems to work well with one thing. While standing my tablet on end(not sideways) it is little tricky to get charge plug in due to plug being on the bottom of tablet. Holder is lower to the surface(table etc.) Oher than that it is a very good adjustable holder that fits many sizes. Great price also. I have bought many Amazon Basics products and very satisfied with them.

Name: Brian
Review Text: I have purchased a few AmazonBasics products and I have never been let down by them. This one is no exception to that. I love that it is light, compact and easily adjustable.I originally bought this stand for my iPad Pro to use it as a second display on my MacBook and wondered if it would be too small. Since it's adjustable to different sizes, I was able to find a good fit for my iPad Pro.Also folds up nicely for travel (perfect for nights at the hotel when you want to watch a movie on your iPad and you place it on the bed).

Name: Doc
Review Title: Works great on flat, stable surfaces
Review Text: It's a great little stand. I use it to hold up my Nexus tablet in my kitchen, so I can watch videos while I wash dishes. It has rubber on the bottom so it doesn't slide around. The arm is adjustable so I can change the viewing angle if desired. The little cutouts in the legs prevent the tablet from slipping out. It folds up, but I never bother folding it up. It was one of the least expensive tablet stands and it does the job well. (It doesn't clamp or hold the tablet positively, so I wouldn't use it on a boat or anything that's bumping around. And the legs are long and straight, so it has to be on a table or counter. But it works great on flat, stable surfaces.)

Name: KT
Review Text: For the money. Awesome. Durable, solid, folds up nice, holds muliple sizes. Ive ised 5" phones, 8" fire tablets, 10" fire tablets, 10" ipad...all holds great. Shoild last a long time. Best stand at this price, only reason to buy anythong else is if you want a permanemt fixtire that also looks expensove (metal,etc). Personality this stamd was exactly what I waa looking for. Protable, durable, and most important usable.Ive bought four of these as gifts for people who asked where I got it.

Name: Kate MahoneyTop Contributor: Cooking
Review Title: PERFECT for our 6 y/o's iPad!  Great price point, very versatile!
Review Text: Our 6 year old son is autistic and his iPad is life.  It is used for fun, education and communication.  We have to buy heavy duty cases for it because he is NOT gentle on technology and takes it everywhere, but often the little plastic kick stands that come built in on those cases don't last more than a week before a hinge breaks or they snap off.  Finally we just decided to buy a separate stand so he could prop it up anywhere without having to worry about the kickstands.  This thing is just perfect.  It's small and light weight, easy to fold up and set up and is pretty much unlimited when it comes to viewing angles.  It works with just about any size or shape of case and you can't beat the price point either!  I have had wonderful experiences with Amazon Basics products (everything from batteries to dog poop bags to tripods to charging cables) and I love that I can save some money that way too!  I can definitely recommend!

Name: ALLFLUKSD
Review Text: I needed to get a stand for my laptop that can convert into a tablet. I was skeptical of any I saw because I have a 17" laptop- so it's MUCH bigger and heavier than the average tablet. I tried this because it looked the most flexible and I'm so glad I did. It's not perfect (I can't manipulate the stand to ANY angle), but it's able to hold my laptop (folded in half) up so that I can use it as a standing tablet and I'm so happy!

Name: ANDEE
Review Text: It's felt like. It doesn't even have anything to sit on like felt will hold it on, it's not sticky or magnetic or anything to hold onto a tablet or smartphone.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Text: Really wasn't expecting much for the price, but this item is great.  The stand on my Kindle case broke and I didn't want to buy another.  Found this and gave it a try.. It holds my Kindle 8 in portrait or horizon.  Last night I figured out how to use it for long calls on my iphone XR.  Very stable and it folds down when not needed.Advice: If at first you don't like it (I didn't) play with the configurations a bit.

Name: Davis
Review Text: Pros:This is a really neat little gizmo. It's highly adjustable and the notches and padding attached to the stand are a neoprene-like material that is a high friction surface to keep your device from sliding.You can move the bottom legs together pretty close and the top arm down to "pinch hold" a phone, or adjust it in a number of ways to hold a larger tablet. Decadence comes into play when you use this stand to hold a tablet in position for hands free viewing of video when laying in bed or on a couch.As others have said, when a device is in portrait mode there is not enough clearance to plug-in a charging cord through the bottom. You can, however, circumvent this by placing the stand so that the front slightly overhangs on a book (for example).I paired this stand with an AmazonBasics Bluetooth Keyboard as well as a bluetooth speaker, and I feel like I've attained small computer nirvana.Cons:The only downside is that the stand doesn't have enough "heft" to hold my tablet in place when I push down on the pressure sensitive surface of my tablet (i.e. the stand doesn't have enough push back) -- but that's mostly when I'm entering my pattern to unlock my device. I've found using swipe motions with my onscreen keyboard problematic as well (hence the use of the bluetooth keyboard).Other Thoughts:If I ever stop using this for my tablet, then this might make a great stand to hold a picture or some tchotchke. The stand probably has 101 uses.

Name: MntnMom
Review Title: Handy tablet support for a 12.9 iPad Pro
Review Text: I use this stand to hold a 12.9 iPad Pro for use as a second monitor, both at home and on the go. It holds the large iPad well in portrait and landscape modes, and folds up small for travel, fitting nicely in my bag. I haven't had any trouble with it folding under the weight of the iPad, but I'm also not pressing on the screen much.

Name: A Harris
Review Text: The stand meets my need to view my 10" tablet in portrait position.  Stand is sturdy, collapsible, and if you position it correctly is very stable for touching screen while on the stand.  I use it primarily when at kitchen table reading newspaper online.  I had purchased one for my wife months ago and she is very pleased with the stand for her 10" tablet.  So, after I got a 10" tablet I eventually decided I needed a stand so I didn't have to hold the tablet when wanting to view in portrait position while doing other things.  My tablet has a cover for viewing landscape, but not portrait.

Name: Flora Jean
Review Text: When its cold out I usually read at my desk at work during lunch.  After using assorted office supplies to try and angle my kindle I decided there had to be a better solution.  I went on Amazon and found their adjustable tablet stand.  I like how the stand can be adjusted for the angle and the width of your device.  I am now able to prop my Kindle up while I eat my lunch.  I can also now adjust the angle so that the overhead lights arenâ€™t causing a glare on my screen.  The rubber pads are a nice touch in preventing the device from slipping off the stand.  When the stand is not in use I just set it to the side of my computer monitor.

Name: srqmoon
Review Text: I bought 2 of these,one for each of my grand daughters to put their tablets on. As small as they are,they're quite sturdy and stable,no problems with the joints when opening them up or closing them, and they're small and light weight enough to take with you wherever you go --- in a purse, suitcase,carry on bag,gym bag,tote bag,etc.  The "feet" spread apart to whatever width you need and have little built in grooves for your device to sit in to support it adequately.. They have nice soft sponge stick-on pads on the "feet" that are very good at protecting furniture and preventing the stand from sliding around. The grandkids say they're worth it and use them every day. Anyone who needs to prop up their phone or tablet a lot should definitely have one of these! No complaints about this handy little helper!

Name: David J. Brumbaugh
Review Title: Hands down this is the best of the best in easels!!!
Review Text: There is absolutely nothing to dislike when it comes to this and I really love it!!! It's Sturdy and very very reliable and you can move it any single way of how you want to prop up an Amazon 10 tablet or an Amazon 8 tablet!! Until this came along my tablet was always laying flat at either my desk or the coffee table. By having it at my desk that if I have any notes for the book that I'm working on that all I have to do is just look at my notes on my tablet thanks to the new easel and simply go right to my laptop computer and type...

Name: Another Avid Reader
Review Text: I use this in cafes to hold either my phone or a Fire tablet, along with a Bluetooth keyboard. It took a bit of playing around, but now I can quickly set it up to hold my phone either landscape or portrait so I can do actual work in a Starbucks.

Name: Farnoosh Brock
Review Text: I got this for my husband. He has an Apple iPad 2 and is loving using it. His hands would get weary of holding the iPad when watching movies or scrolling and this stand was the perfect solution.We also wanted to make sure we order from AmazonBasics to experience their products. It arrived as fast as it said it would.Packing was done well and in a minimal way - I like that. The adjustable table stand is all folded up when you get it. It's pretty sturdy and you have to pry it open and then adjust it to the level and angle that you like.This stand is light and portable and you can just throw it in your bag and travel with it. Hardly takes up any space. It also works with the Kindle which is really nice, although I have yet to prop it up on the bed to hold my Kindle. Perhaps I'll give that a whirl. Love this great tool and highly recommend it.

Name: Merry
Review Text: It's a cool concept and it really does fold up to a tiny size. It's also cheap enough that I don't expect perfection. My only gripe is that the adjustments are pretty big when you click it into position; that is, you don't have a lot of angles to choose from. So when I use it with a webcam, it's either chopping off the top of my head or the bottom of my head. I'd still give it three stars for people who use video chat a lot, or five stars for people who don't.

Name: J. Devenberg
Review Title: I usually love Amazon Basics products
Review Text: I usually love Amazon Basics products, but I'm mildly disappointed in this one.  I figured an Amazon Basics tablet stand would work well with Amazon's own tablets.  I have the 2017 Fire HD8 and, while this stand will hold it, it isn't as stable as I'd like.  It seems pretty clear this stand was built with larger tablets in mind.

Name: KTH0707
Review Text: Perfect for most tablets. Especially at this price point. Very sturdy and simple. I did find that I can not charge my iPad while it in portrait orientation. There isn't enough clearance at the base to for the cable. So that was kind of a bummer as I use my iPad Air for teleconferencing and like to have it on a power source so that I don't kill the battery while doing so.Otherwise a very good stand.

Name: Katherine
Review Text: When I was looking for a stand for my iPad mini, I was torn between about 6 different stands. I finally got this one because Iâ€™ve had great experiences with all things that are â€œAmazonBasicsâ€ (computer mouse, phone sleeve, phone charger and batteries). Ummmm now my great experience has continued. I wouldnâ€™t think thereâ€™d be much to say about a tablet stand, but yeah, this one is pretty great. I have absolutely nothing to compare it to, but all I know is that it perfect in every way. First of all, the grip on the bottom makes it to where it doesnâ€™t slip at ALL. If I have my iPad mini upright on the stand on a table, I can press on it with one finger and it doesnâ€™t move in the slightest. â€¦.Including the home button which requires a stronger push! You can position it in SO many different ways, allowing it to accommodate your every need! :P I have a flip case on my iPad, but i seriously canâ€™t stand using the case as a stand even though itâ€™s meant for thatâ€¦ it always slips making it go flat! My boyfriend and I both have iPads, but I only bought one to make sure it was good enough, so weâ€™ll now be buying a second one!

Name: Jessie Franklin
Review Text: It worked alright for the first two months of use. My kindergartener used it daily for her iPad for online learning. The stand didn't manipulate well enough for her to seen well on screen, she was still barely visible. The pads to keep it from sliding on the table fell off after 1 day. After two months of use, the stand pretty much fell apart and all the screws and nuts came out at once. Couldn't put it back together.

Name: just review it!
Review Text: I've owned thus for about four years now and it has performed excellent.I began using it with an Android tablet but a few years ago I switched to iPad and it works just as well. You can use it with a tablet or phone either horizontally or vertically. Even though my tablet case allows it to stand on its own, it only does so vertically.I also use a Logitech portable keyboard that only lays flat. I take the top edge of the keyboard and lay it in the front edge of the stand, this allows for a more natural feeling when typing.

Name: Ansatz
Review Title: Use your tablet anywhere around the house
Review Text: This lets you bring your tablet with you and watch videos or listen to music anywhere. It's great for watching videos while cooking or doing other chores around the house. It's also great for playing workout videos while you follow along. Your tablet basically turns into a portable TV. Because it's angled, the screen will be facing you and the speaker will not be against the ground, as would be the case if you just left it lying around. I have tried leaning my tablet against objects before I had this stand, but it always slips.

Name: Michelle
Review Text: My brother bought our mother an Amazon Fire Tablet, which she loves. But she was using it in her sewing room and in the kitchen, for tutorials and recipes, but it didn't have a stand. So, I bought this for her and it is absolutely perfect. She can have the tablet either way and the stand holds it perfectly. It is well made, very stable, arrived right on time and well packaged. It was a great purchase.

Name: Meurer Graphics
Review Text: I am perfectly happy with the stand.  It is sturdy/rugged and easy to use at the same time.  I couldn't quite tell from the pictures and the product description how the stand unfolded.  I imagined there would be some kind of release or wingnut that would tighten and loosen the joints for adjustment.  It actually just clicks into place however you want it.  When you move the feet and head, you can feel the clicks as you move it.  The teeth on the interior of the device that are clicking are closely spaced allowing for finite adjustment to the precise position desired. I am using it for a travel monitor for my small form factor computer when traveling.  Can't wait to throw it in my backpack and go!

Name: Gregory C. Poe
Review Text: I use it with my tablet, and there have got to be around 30 different angles you can make with it, since there are multiple hinges. It even fits your cell phone, and I have used it to hold up my phone for shooting videos. Plus, it folds up into a 6-inch rid, so it can be easily stored in a drawer. This product is perfect, and I've used it for many hours of reading and watching Netflix.This only potential downfall: It needs a solid surface to sit on. This is not optimal for reading in bed. Though, there are other solutions for that.

Name: Lance Y
Review Text: This is the perfect device to hold up various tablet style devices. Used with 10.5-inch iPad and 8-inch Android tablet and it's great in that you can change the tilt angle. It has rubberized grips to keep the device from slipping, and collapses down to a very small size to easily fit in a backpack or purse. If you device doesn't have a built in kickstand and you want to prop it up in either portrait or landscape, this is the perfect gadget. Solid build but fairly lightweight. Definitely recommend!

Name: K. Douglas
Review Title: Awesome stand... Well worth the amazing price!
Review Text: This  really is an awesome stand! Forget about all the other way more expensive options that fail to achieve the simple desired result. This holds my iPad 10.2 perfectly at any angle - landscape or portrait. It is very stable and sturdy. I gave up on finding a versatile cover that also worked as a stand and went with this option instead. It also looks quite nice. After receiving the first one I bought another one to keep in another area - for this price you can have them all over your house.

Name: Jessica
Review Text: Since I had to start working from home due to the whole mandate, I got a portable monitor that was 15 inches and it was really hard to find a stand that could support it. Most tablet stands are just for iPads and tablets which arenâ€™t bigger than about 14 inches. Now I can use this stand for both my monitor and my iPhone if need be.For versatility I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because you canâ€™t adjust the height.

Name: Retriever5
Review Title: Useful and works well, has slight shaking/stability issues.
Review Text: Great, adjustable, with slight but barely noticeable stability problems.I'm currently using it for my Fire HD 7, and it fits it just fine! It also works with my Fire HD 10.It shipped in just 24 hours. Easy setup, as well! With bigger, heavier tablets, it may wobble a little, but that is not an issue unless you're tapping the screen super hard.It seems the back part is slightly offset to the left, which doesn't matter when using the tablet, although if I were to move the stand with the tablet in it, it'd wobble.With my bulky case on it, it will make it a bit less stable, but using my other slim, light case, it's fine.9/10 Durable, useful, slight shaking and stability issues.

Name: D. Kruse
Review Text: I use a 10" Insignia tablet with this stand.The stand is not very sturdy in the least. Any tablet that is as tall at the one I use will create a top heaviness and render the stand very weak. If you tap your screen too hard, the stand will collapse sending your tablet to the ground.This stand packs up nicely to throw in any bag but the strength of the stand isn't very good at all.

Name: Jay
Review Text: It looks like it would fit most sizes and shapes.  I have the Samsung Galaxy S7+ in a SaharaCase armor and this does the job most of the time.  I can adjust the arm in the back to set it to different heights, depending on what angle I want to observe the screen at.  The problem is, my tab S7+ is too heavy for it to support.  If I put it at certain angles, it will suddenly 'give out' and the stand arm will fall flat under the weight of the tablet.  The tab will fall down onto the table.  It is protected in an armored case, so it isn't broken, but it is frustrating that the stand will not support my device.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Text: First, this was delivered ahead of schedule. Second, it worked great for me. The legs and arm are adjustable so I can change the direction of the tablet to suit my needs. Once placed on the stand, my tablet didnâ€™t move. This is a very basic, yet sturdy tablet stand. I will be buying another one for my son to use.

Name: D. Swift
Review Text: I bought this about a month ago (mid-April 2020) because of all of the virtual meetings that my family needed to do as part of the pandemic.  At $9 ... mathematically, I had to do it.  I have to say that I was not disappointed.  We have 9.7â€ iPads and it works fantastic!  At $9, I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised as to how sturdy the stand is.  It also has 2 vertical bend points which allows for incredible flexibility on positioning the angle of the device.  This is a winner!

Name: Joy
Review Text: I have a 2020 iPad Pro 12.9.  The tablet dwarfs this stand which contributes to the instability if you touch the screen for any reason.  If you're just parking a larger tablet on this stand, on a flat surface with no intention of doing anything with it then it'll do.  I wanted to draw and write on the iPad while resting on the stand and it doesn't work, as it will tip over.

Name: M.Hernandez
Review Title: The Perfect Stand Doesnâ€™t Exist......And I Oop..
Review Text: Listen, I buy a gazillion things a year from amazon. Iâ€™m pretty sure I am the reason theyâ€™re a trillion dollar company. But I never ever write reviews. Today,  I actually stopped everything I was doing to come here and say how much I love this stand. Itâ€™s super sturdy, adjusts to many different positions, is compact and looks great. It holds my IPad Pro with ease. I spent almost 1k dollar on my iPad so believe me when I tell you this purchase is worth it. Maybe for future versions Amazon can make it even more compact and tiny so I can carry it in my pocket. But beyond that, itâ€™s perfect.

Name: M. Night Shyam-alien
Review Title: Portable, but not the most durable or stable.
Review Text: Pros:The stand folds up pretty small which makes it portable, and it is plastic so it's lightweight. It's very adjustable and you can get just the right angle with a little work.Cons:Everything is held in place by teeth that lock together as you adjust, and they seem to already be wearing down making it just a little more flimsy.The tripod shaped footprint of the base makes it unstable. Keeping my portable monitor standing securely on anything soft like a bed or couch is nigh impossible.

Name: Jim Bridger
Review Text: It lasted a while but eventually cracked and broke. Adjusting it constantly is annoying, and it eventually gets loose and wont stay. It's also super slippery and your device will slide around. I wont buy it again.

Name: Joseph O.
Review Title: A surprisingly good choice and will buy as gifts
Review Text: AmazonBasics Adjustable Tablet Stand - This stand is a beast. It's sturdier than it appears with a heavy plastic and rigid adjustments that clamps on firmly to its position. Its small and compact and has a soft yoga mat material under the legs and back rest. Its so well balanced I even watch my kindle with it on my stomach! A surprisingly good choice and will buy as gifts. Highly recommend.

Name: Iris A.
Review Title: Why didn't I purchase this sooner???
Review Text: I use this with my Kindle Keyboard, in it's leather case, and the tablet stand works perfectly. With different adjustments to the width of the base and the angle of the back, it should work for many types of devices. After years of propping up my Kindle with a cookbook, a Perquackey game, a pillow... you name it... I finally have something that holds my Kindle at a good angle for reading while having breakfast or lunch. Now I can put all that stuff back where it belongs instead of cluttering up my kitchen.

Name: ADM
Review Text: This amazing & affordable little gizmo works perfectly on iPads, iPhones, Kindle Fire, other tablets & phablets. Now that I'm teleworking, this stand makes it easy to utilize a second screen with my laptop for conference calls & video meetings. This stand also works in the kitchen if you're looking at recipes, playing music & singing along with the lyrics, or relaxing & reading on your device.  It's sturdy, flexible and perfect! This price is pretty sweet too :-)

Name: AMT
Review Text: I'm sure this stand works fine for most people. However, I just did not like it. I took a chance because of the price and was still disappointed. The legs come with 3 preset spreadable widths. The articulating arm is neat in theory but weak in practicality. Just not a fan and can't recommend.

Name: kristen
Review Title: Itâ€™s super affordable and it does the job!
Review Text: Its not a very flashy design, but itâ€™s very affordable and it does the job :) :) I love to use my iPad in the kitchen with a recipe pulled up. I used to prop it up between the wall and a heavy container that would hold it in place, but now I feel more comfortable knowing itâ€™s secure and wonâ€™t get scratched.I also travel a lot. I think it folds up nicely that I could take it with me on the plane to watch tv shows while in the air :)

Name: Jennifer
Review Text: After giving this thing better placement on my computer desk I've found it to be very helpful and convenient. It holds my tablet which is all I need. I can call for Alexa and it hears me from the couch. The product is sturdy enough to get the job done and thatd all I need. I feel that it's worth the money and it makes me happy. I have a kindle fire 10 and it fits just fine.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Text: Holds an iPad in a otter box style case. Had several angle to get the right position for viewing. Folds up compact for easy storage when not in use. Would definitely purchase again if something happens to this one.

Name: BigD
Review Title: It works but won't/doesn't last long.
Review Text: The lower "click" locking mechanism for the various base configurations loosens very quickly.  I have found that, with no way to tighten the central pivot on the lower support(s), that it'll stay in place because of the rubberized foam on the bottom but will shift if the tablet shifts.  So, to help with this, while using the support with a tablet, the use of a light pull rubber band between the supports, helps quite a bit to prevent the shift.

Name: Ren F.
Review Text: I've barely had this a full month and the foam on the back stand is already peeling. Each time I would remove my tablet the stand would stick to it and then drop down, when I noticed it was like that. I use it on my desk to hold my tablet all day (I have the Samsung 7+ tab). It does wobble a little bit from time to time but I like the simple form of it. If not for the peeling and occasional wobble this would have been great.

Name: Chelle Taylor
Review Text: I use reviews to help me choose products so I wanted to share my experience.  This is a great tablet stand! It holds my Samsung Tab S7, which is quite large, both vertically & horizontally very well. I love how adjustable it is. It has grip on the "legs" so it doesn't slide around on my lap desk. It also works well for my phone, a Samsung Note 20. My favorite thing is how small it folds up so it fits perfectly in my tablet sleeve for travel use. It is made with hard plastic and after about a month of use, shows no signs of becoming loose in the "joints". Highly recommend!

Name: Casey
Review Text: Bought these for the children as a stand for their iPads when they were watching videos. Exactly what we were looking for. They seem to be well made. They have some foam pads that seemed to wear out quickly but doesnâ€™t hurt the function of the product.

Name: RC Satterfield
Review Text: I signed up for a series of video conference calls and my new desktop computer didnâ€™t have a camera. I bought this stand to hold my iPad at the right angle to use the camera for these calls. The standâ€™s arms have many positions and may be adjusted incrementally.  The stand folds up into a slim, lightweight portable size that may be slipped into a pocket or purse.  It was a great inexpensive solution to my problem. It may be used to hold other devices, too.

Name: elgranrafo
Review Title: It's good but could be better
Review Text: This stand is great for watching media as it frees your hands from holding the tablet. It's light, portable and economic. You can adjust the tilt angle and works with your phone too. The only thing that is a negative is the durability; the bolt that holds it together came loose after some use. If this flaw gets fixed it would be 5-star.

Name: J. F. Sweeney
Review Text: Everyone should have one of these! We now have three! Easily and instantly adjustable for cellphones and tablets. Great design, good materials used, and substantial. Folds down to small size (large candybar?) to pack and carry. Similar items cost far more. This thing is a worldbeater!Got a dashboard GPS? Expensive (now broken) heavy-duty stand? Been there. We now use one of these to hold the GPS unit. Think about it. It's non-skid, infinitely adjustable for your unit, and won't slide off your dash if you set it up correctly.I drive, he navigates. This gadget is a winner. That's why I ordered several more. Ten stars!

Name: Stephanie
Review Title: Good stand, adjusts to hold tablet, monitor or phone in place.
Review Text: Works well to hold my 15 inch portable monitor. I travel for work and this well built, very adjustable, and sturdy stand folds up to be really compact and portable. I use it to hold myÂ ASUS MB168B 15.6" WXGA 1366x768 USB Portable Monitor  , (which is actually 18" diagonally). It has been working out great. It is easy to adjust and I imagine it would work to hold up a cell phone just as well as it holds up my larger portable monitor.Price: @ $8.99 with prime free shipping, you can't go wrong.

Name: R. Morgan
Review Text: Bought this stand for our Samsung Galaxy Tab A 10.1" (2019) and it holds it perfectly in both portrait and landscape positions. This stand adjusts to all kinds of angles - the legs can spread out far or come in close, the back post angles up or down, and the back post rest can also pivot. Notches in the legs keep tablet in place even when the tablet is in a case.The stand is very light and can fold up quickly to get stored away. We just leave it out because it kind of looks cool.

Name: amazonreviewer67
Review Title: Highly adjustable tablet stand - secure viewing in either landscape or portrait mode
Review Text: Extremely portable, stable stand that has enough adjustable points (back, legs, center) that it would likely fit almost any tablet. Folds down to a ~1" x1" x7" lightweight 'stick' that's easy to carry anywhere. Offers secure, easy tablet screen viewing in either landscape or portrait mode. "Feet" and adjustable top support both feature a gripper surface for extra security. Nice wide notches hold my Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 7.0"  tablet securely in place - even with its slimline tablet case on it. My slimline case has a 'foldback' feature that permits angled viewing -- but this foldup tablet stand permits safer, 'perched' viewing on, say, a kitchen counter, where fluids may spill. A simple stand that is designed for near universal use, and is so adjustable that you likely won't need to buy a different one if  you buy another tablet or e-reader. (How many electronics accessories can you say THAT about?) A very worthwhile purchase,

Name: Alexander
Review Text: Im very surprised.  As soon as I took it out of the box I was doubtful of the stand mostly because of its light weight but I ended loving this for my iPad pro 12.9 inch tablet.  I'm going to buy 2 or 3 more for myself and my family.

Name: Robin M.
Review Title: if you like to use your device for reading at a desk ...
Review Text: This is an extremely handy device to have, if you like to use your device for reading at a desk or table (while eating a meal, etc.)  I would have given it a 5-star rating if it were not for the fact that the rubber feet on the bottom of the unit keep coming loose and need to be re-glued.  That's not in line with the quality I have found on most AmazonBasics items I've purchased.  (Maybe I just need to buy better glue.)

Name: Twiz
Review Text: Good quality materials and workmanship make this ultra-portable stand very handy.  Small enough to fit into a pants pocket (or woman's handbag) or most any carry-case for a tablet, it folds out into a sturdy stand (with non-slip rubber feet) that can be adjusted for most any device (phone or tablet) and for most any view angle desired.  Great stand at a great price, I highly recommend it.

Name: Trishakers
Review Title: The design allows easy access to the on/off
Review Text: This little stand is all that is needed in a tablet stand. It has rubber on the legs that grip well and prevent sliding on the surface it is on. It adjusts to any position that I could possibly want. The tablet sits firmly in the slots and does not tip on either side. The design allows easy access to the on/off, volume controls. I love being able to just pick up the tablet and go without having to pry it out of corner holders. The only drawback is that you cannot rotate the tablet with the charger slot down as there is not enough clearance. I solve that problem by putting the stand on top of a small box that allows the tablet to overhang just enough in the front to get the clearance. This works fine also, without everything tipping. Very happy with this purchase.

Name: I. Erickson
Review Text: I say : buy this guy! If you want something adjustable for large phones, iPad or mini iPad, you canâ€™t go wrong. It has soft padding on the bottom side. The padding makes it stable, prevents tipping or sliding and it sort of hugs the surface you place it on. It folds into a kind of rod you can put in a pocket or purse. I use it a lot and  I love it.

Name: TOMB
Review Text: I purchased after seeing my co-worker using one after trying to use the "case" stand that came with my monitor. Adjustable for the right tilt and sturdy. Collapses down where it fits in my travel case that I use for the monitor, fitting in that extra inch along the top. Liked it so much that I purchased for son when I bought him a monitor as well.

Name: Corinne
Review Title: Homer un on product but they doubled the price.
Review Text: I had one it broke after 5 years thatâ€™s great wear and tear. Thanks ðŸ™Bed bath and beyond sells 200 sheeets and a year later they are ripped or looked like theyâ€™ve been washed to much. Donâ€™t buy beechwood sheets. Bottom line.Amazon if you guys read this maybe you can sell warranties on your higher priced items and extensions. Thatâ€™s a thing that Loweâ€™s does and wearhouse discount center. Talk about backing up what you sell and making money as well for the warranty

Name: Rayster
Review Text: This is my second, I gave my first one to a friend.  This stand is easy to position for your best viewing angle.  It fits the new iPad perfectly, but I imagine it would work on any tablet.  I love it because it's light, padded in all the right places, and it came almost overnight.  Like little reindeer delivered it.  I thought they were off now...

Name: AFA_Prof
Review Title: Sturdy. Attractive. But cannot charge tablet while vertical in the stand (as pictured)
Review Text: An amazing device--so long as you don't want to have your device plugged in for power. When tablet is in the vertical position, there is not sufficient room at the bottom to plug in the power cable without seriously bending the wire (which will eventually break the cable). I keep mine plugged in so I have to use it either in the horizontal position or upside down so cable comes in at the top.I like to read news at a table. This adjustable stand is sturdy holds my iPad very well. Doesn't look at all like the picture when it's completely folded up upon arrival. Don't despair--just open it up intuitively and voila! It's very attractive even when tablet is removed.

Name: P. O'Brien
Review Title: Kind to my neck and back.
Review Text: It is very difficult to maintain good neck and back posture while reading my Paperwhite at my kitchen table. And when the sun changes angles, I have problems adjusting the book angle without adding pressure to my elbows. This device is amazing. Easy to use, stable, compact to store, and inexpensive. I only wish I had looked for it two years ago.

Name: Paul
Review Text: Great tablet stand.  Quite versatile, stable, and sturdy.  Could a better one be designed if price were no object?  Sure, but why pay $30 or more when the $11 one works great.  It holds my I-pad and my wife's Fire tablet just fine with or without cases.  It can be used for a phone stand, but its larger than needed for that purpose.  Very pleased with the purchase.  Would buy again.

Name: Carrie B.
Review Text: You will not find a better stand to hold almost anything in any position. We have four of these around the house. I use it for my iPad and my phone while at the kitchen table every morning. My husband also uses it for his phone and Fire tablet. And we both use them for reading in bed with our Amazon Fire devises. Also, the price is great for such a useful thing. Don't waste you money on more sophisticated or expensive stands.

Name: Allan Lambkin
Review Text: This is such a great product. Got it for my mother who loves her iPad and uses it constantly for FaceTime, email, social media and looking at recipes and videos while in the kitchen. It is highly functional and adaptable to multiple viewing angles and is great for FaceTime, reading and viewing content. We particularly love how sturdy it is and doesnâ€™t budge while interacting with the screen. Also has really grippy rubber legs that prevent it from moving or shifting on most surfaces. Although itâ€™s branded as a â€˜AmazonBasicsâ€™ product it has a solid feel to it and I feel like the build quality is great.  Unlike a lot of  other stands it folds up into a compact rectangle that makes it really portable and mobile.Will definitely be picking up a few more of theses as gifts for some of the other fam. Really happy with this product.

Name: old hen
Review Text: I bought one of those pillows for my Kindle10 and when I put it in like it showed I couldn't access my icons and I would have to hold it by hand, not what I wanted. Bought this and I absolutely love it, I can put my Kindle in any direction and it holds it securely and the cost was 1/2 the price for the pillow thing.  Thank you Amazon for making a useful product.

Name: EA4Afterburner!
Review Text: I bought three adjustable stands and gave two away as gifts. Works well and the pricepoint fits my budget. Good materials and has rubber pads on the backarm that holds the tablet in place and to whatever angle your tablet needs to be in. Bottom footings also have rubber pads and they adjust out into a V shape to hold your tablet in place. Prime eligible and got it in two days. I have a Sam Sung 10.5 inch tablet and it holds it very well. Its pretty compact in size when you fold it up after use. It works well with any tablet that has a tablet cover such as a Otterbox Defender as a example. It also works well if you have a separate keyboard and choose not to use the cover/keyboard as your platform. Summary, its a pretty neat gadget to have if you own a tablet and it fits in any bag due to its compact size. Hope that helps.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Title: This is wonderful for the price and adjustable for just he right angle.
Review Text: I don't know what  I did before finding this wonderful little piece of "equipment"! It is so adjustable and just folds up when not in use. What a great deal for the price. I would recommend it for anyone's tablet for reading or puzzles, games, wonderful for use when you are making a recipe that is on your tablet, whatever you use your tablet for it is great.

Name: David S.
Review Text: After having used the cover stand that is weird for over a year, now having this is an amazing difference.  My Kindle and my phone can be put on the stand and held quite nicely for when I want to sit at a table or counter and use them.  It is quick to set up, it holds the Kindle easily and steadily with no slipping.  Well done, awesome!

Name: Bicycle Chick
Review Text: I twice purchased a flimsier model. First broke when I tried to use it. Second broke after few weeks without even much use. So I ordered this model because looked sturdier....and it is, by a long shot.  It holds my units even with their protective cases on.  It adjusts to different size units, like nook, iPad, etc. I can even make it work for an iPhone 6s.  Legs adjust wider to narrower. Reading tilt extremely adjustable. Sets very securely on surfaces (my other model did not)..  will order a second one, so one to stay home and one for my on-the-go bag. I see no downside so far.  Kudos to the inventor.

Name: Carolyn Valdez
Review Text: I really love this product. I uses It for my Kindle Fire and it holds it in any position I want it to be in which is great. It is very sturdy and stable and I love the little grips on the bottom which keeps it from sliding across the table or any other flat surface that you might have it on.I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a tablet stand.

Name: K679583EJP
Review Title: Very good and reliable simple stand
Review Text: The media could not be loaded.                  Â My 7 yrs old Broke his iPad holder stand  so I bought him this amazon basic stand and itâ€™s very good. He has been using this stand for about two months now since I got it from my mailbox and itâ€™s still havenâ€™t broke. It stand any election from iPad, iphone, mini laptop and even a dinner plate and it doesnâ€™t fall on table, floor or on carpet.

Name: Sh0poww
Review Text: I bought this for my niece since she would always lean he iPad against other things for it to stand. It really fits the iPad in place.There are grooves at the bottom legs for your device to fit in place. The legs are also are adjustable depending on the size. Even my phone (I have an iPhone 7 Plus) was able to be used on it.Overall itâ€™s a nice inexpensive stand for your phone, tablet, iPad, etc. Two thumbs up for this product!

Name: P. Anderson
Review Text: We bought this because our grandson is doing distance learning. This is simple and perfect. It is very easy to adjust to get just the angle you want. It is very well designed, and holds it position well, while remaining simple to readjust if desired. Should work just as well as a book stand, and it folds up to a very compact bundle.

Name: Little House on the Prairie
Review Title: Holds anything from an iphone to an ipad
Review Text: Purchased this to be able to stand up my kindle or iPhone while on a plane but realized I can also use it at home while FaceTiming or reading a recipe while cooking. Great for hands free use! The legs can be brought close enough to hold an iPhone upright. It might be a little wobbly on a plane in that position but it's definitely sturdy on a solid surface. It will hold any device with a case or cover on it. The only downside is that it doesn't hold the device quite high enough to have the charger plugged in at the bottom. But for the price and versatility, you can't go wrong!

Name: David Sattler
Review Text: After months of use it's still sturdy and does its job. Works equally well with my iPad in portrait and landscape mode; I use a bluetooth keyboard and have a poor man's laptop. Folds flat to toss into a suitcase for travel. Works with my iPhone, too, though I rarely use it that way. Hinges are still tight and feet are still stable. No complaints.

Name: StillaYankee
Review Text: Got this for my new 12.9" IPadPro.  For the price I figured I'd give it a shot since some reviews said it worked ok in landscape mode which is how I use my IPad 98% of the time.  The box was small & my kids laughed thinking there was no way it would hold this large IPad but it does just fine, even in portrait mode.  It has a small footprint but feels sturdy enough to hold my IPad at any angle I want without fear of collapsing or tipping over.  Combine function with the very low price & I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a stand for any tablet they have.

Name: WideAndNerdy
Review Title: It does what it needs to do.
Review Text: Works well for standing vertically or horizontally. I've owned this for about a month and it seems very sturdy. the rubbery foam pads on the bottom prevent sliding and the vertically extending arm has the same rubbery foam pad to help hold it in place. The arm locks firmly into a sufficient number of positions for viewing as long as the stand is not above your eye line and yet is easily adjusted without having to set or unset anything.Its a simple design thats well suited for holding a Fire Tablet. Mine is the 7 inch tablet but the stand appears big enough and its arms definitely hold firmly enough for the 8.9 inch tablet as well.EDIT: 8 months later, everything I've said is still true. However in that time I've discovered a small flaw, the base is not really thick enough to plug in the charge cable underneath if the Kindle is oriented so that the microUSB port is on the bottom. Normally this isn't a problem with the Amazon player as you can flip the tablet any which way you want to address that problem but if you're using a third party app, those sometimes only play the video on one orientation as one of my apps does. Its a minor nuisance. The killer is, they're only maybe 1mm to 2mm off of being thick enough, its like they based the width on the head of the micro usb plug but didn't account for the cable coming out the bottom.

Name: JOJO
Review Title: Functional, light weight stand for most tablets (not for large iPad Pro)
Review Text: This is my second purchase of this product (because I misplaced the first one).  It is functional, light weight and portable.  It works well for the iPad, iPad Air 2 and iPad Pro 9.7"  I find that it is not sturdy enough for the iPad Pro 12.9 in portrait mode, I had to order a different stand to meet that need.

Name: Dedicated Follower of Ray
Review Title: A rare case of cheap and simple being best
Review Text: I use this for my Microsoft Surface Pro (the full sized version), which I keep in portrait mode most of of the time.  I also bought a few other tablet stands to try out.  For my money, this is the best because of its simplicity, portability, and price.  I bought several of these -- one for my desktop, where I dock my Surface to a monitor; a second one I keep in my computer bag, and a third that I keep near the kitchen table.  No drama, no fuss, no muss.

Name: NikonEsque
Review Text: Although this stand is advertised for tablets, I am using it with my Lepow 15" portable monitor. Very stable and can be configured. The Lepow magnetic cover can supposedly be used as a monitor stand, but I couldn't get it to work and it was very unstable.Not much to this device. It's not fancy but it works great.

Name: BGunner
Review Text: I had purchased a more stylish tablet holder that miserably failed and had to be sent back.  I spent a lot of time looking around and decided to try this one despite it's looks.  This one works exactly as it should and holds my tablet at the angle I want without slippage.  I have only displayed and charged the device in landscape so I can't speak for the ability to charge it in portrait.  I have an OtterBox on the device and it does not hinder the stand in the least.  My only wish for it was that it would be a bit nicer to look at but sometimes the simplest is the best.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Stable, lightweight, well made, great design, fair price
Review Text: Stable, lightweight, quality construction, great design, fair price.  I use my ASUS MemoPad 7 in this stand and it is much more secure and adjustable than using the prop-up feature of my Tablet case.  The foam inserts are impressively well done. The whole geometry of this thing is just right.. So it works when my tablet is in either landscape or portrait orientation.  I take this with me in my commuter pack along with the tablet and my small laptop.So I can have the tablet open alongside my laptop, almost like a second display (with incoming emails always in view). The stand has the perfect range of adjustment. I wish it was a bit lighter weight, but I think as it is, the stand is about as light as they can make it without compromising stability and strength. A stand like this really improves the tablet experience, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this one.UPDATE OCTOBER 2014-My wife each have one, and really enjoy them. Both are going strong with no problems or issues.

Name: ZombieJill
Review Title: ... a two week vacation and it was a surprisingly useful little device to have
Review Text: This little tablet stand was purchased to accompany me on a two week vacation and it was a surprisingly useful little device to have. I used this with my iPad, which has one of those magnetic covers that Apple makes that can convert into a stand of sorts, so I sort-of figured I wouldn't get much use out of this stand, but it is superior in just about every way to Apple's flimsy solution. The cruise (and the flights to said cruise) were rough, and my iPad kept falling over whenever everything would shake, but this stand held it firm and prevented my device from slipping and sliding around.I was able to use it comfortably with both my iPad 2 and my Samsung Galaxy Note 3 phone, thanks to the adjustable nature of the stand, and it works great for both devices regardless of orientation. It folds up tiny and fit perfectly into an inside pocket of my carry-on bag, and is made of sturdy plastic. Now that I'm home, I plan on keeping this in and around my kitchen to hold my tablet while I'm cooking, but it will definitely be coming with me during on my next vacation.I bought this in conjunction with theÂ AmazonBasics Bluetooth Keyboard for Apple Devices (iPad, iPad Mini, iPhone)  Â so I could more comfortably write and work from the cruise ship, and the combination was excellent for my needs. I absolutely recommend both products to anyone looking to increase functionality while on the go.

Name: Hannah
Review Text: I liked it so much I bought 2 more.Very sturdy and stable to use for even my work tablet that's pretty heavy due to the protective casing that it's in. It doesn't take up too much space. I can fold it up and stash it away when not in use, or put in my bag to use on the go. It's versatile because of the adjustable height and width - I can use it for my work tablet, iPad Air, and Samsung Galaxy Note 9 phone - either upright  or horizontally/landscape. My son uses it for his Samsung Galaxy Tab A.

Name: David Pearlman
Review Title: Great ergonomics, will fit just about any size or dimension portable tablet, but be aware of the cheap construction
Review Text: I was looking for a fully adjustable stand to replace the one-position stand for my Microsoft Surface. This seemed to fill the bill and I ordered it.The pros:1) Fully adjustable. Very easy to put your tablet in almost any position from full 90 degree (standing up) to around 0 degrees (almost lying down).2) Sturdy enough (touching the screen, the tablet stays in place).3) The "sticky" rubber guides keep your tablet in place.4) Easy to set up.5) Will work with any standard tablet from 7" to 12" either portrait or landscape. It will actually work with larger tablets, but as things get too big, it's not going to be very stable.Now the con:1) It's almost entirely plastic, and it doesn't feel well enough constructed to last for the long run if you're using it as a travel device (where you'll continually be folding/unfolding it and possibly subjecting it to travel stresses). Should be fine if you just want to set it up somewhere and leave it.I was disappointed with the plastic design. It looks like metal in the pictures here. It's not. I guess at the price I shouldn't have expected anything more. I am a little worried how well it will hold up in the long term. But the ergonomics are great, and it's kind of amazing that there are so few comparably good general use stands at this price. Basically, Amazon has this particular market to themselves.On the whole, as long as you keep your expectations in check, this is a great little stand.

Name: ChristianFromPeru
Review Text: Works amazing for my iPad (Forget what version, but not air or pro or mini... just normal iPad from a year or two ago).  I usually use it in horizontal mode and the power plug works perfectly that way, but you'd have to have it "upside down" with the home button on top if you want to use it vertically.  Works great for me. :)

Name: Jim C
Review Text: I love this stand. It's sturdy, easily adjustable and folds down to easily fit in a carrying case pocket. As some of the others have stated in reviews, if you're using it to hold in portrait mode, the charging cable can be an issue as there isn't enough clearance underneath. That is completely forgivable, in my opinion.

Name: M. Mccarthy
Review Text: I like the adjustability of this stand.  The bottom has padding that grips to the surface so it doesnâ€™t slide around.  There is also a non slip padding where the device leans against.  Itâ€™s also adjustable,  makes it perfect for just about any situation, or device size.  Iâ€™ve used it for a large iPad and a small iPhone.

Name: Mike M
Review Title: Great Product at an Unbelievable Price!
Review Text: This stand is very versatile!  I bought two and are now gone (my daughter and wife won't give them back!)  Purchased them for holding my tablets while distance teaching during the school closures.  They are adjustable and did I mention priced low?  I'm going to order 2 more.  They will hold ipad pro 12" tablets and well as the Amazon Fire HD 10.  They also hold ipads with the Otterbox cases too.

Name: kgv
Review Text: These just arrived and I put them to use for virtual school in our home. They are very sturdy and I love that you can adjust the tilt level so easily. Sturdy enough that when my kids mute/unmute go into another app, the iPads don't fall over like they were doing when they were relying on the iPad tri-folding cover flap ðŸ™ŒðŸ½

Name: Jus
Review Text: This is a compact and very nice collapsible stand. I got this specifically for my Kindle so that I can read in portrait mode. I was foolish enough to buy a case that only allows for propping it up in landscape mode. So for the price this was worth a shot. I have no idea on how well it will hold up over time as I just got it, but I like the rubberized areas where your tablet or whatever will rest against, and it just does the job it sets out to do.

Name: Iceman
Review Title: Perfect for a wooden desk but comes up short in the bedroom!
Review Text: Generally speaking a good item.  The stand has cushioned "feet" so that it wont scratch your desk.  However the cushioning gets stuck on anything soft like a pillow or blanket.  Which means that if you like to read in bed then the soft feet will get pulled out easily.  I put duct tape around the feet which solves the problem, though it doesn't look very attractive.  Amazon should either design cushions that stick to the plastic base but not to other cushions or perhaps make a "sleepy time" model to go along with this daytime model.

Name: Brian McLaughlin
Review Title: Great for the price! Tablet stand works very very well!
Review Text: I purchased one of these because I had a class to take which no longer gives out physical books. I wound up using my Ipad and thought it would be nice to have a stand to read from. Boy is this thing great. It is very compact, as it folds down easily. It is very light since it is made from plastic. I also really like that it is so adjustable. It can fit many size devices on it, though i would say an iPhone 6 is too small unless it is in portrait mode. Any type of tablet should fit with ease though. it is also very stable, and has a bit of a coating on the bottom so it wont slip across a table or anything.  For the price, this is great - especially if you're using it for a tablet.  For a phone, I would go with another option though.

Name: JEM
Review Text: This "Amazon Basic" is surprisingly simple in design, yet precisely what is needed - and nothing more. What I mean is that it is nearly perfect in form and function, especially for anyone who travels. By the look of the stand I was concerned that the stand would easily slip out of position or worse, my iPad would fall off the stand if I touched the screen. Not at all - this stand firmly supports your tablet in either portrait or landscape position, with a confident grip that is uncanny. I happen to have an iPad, but it will work equally well for any tablet. Just spread the base fully open and click the backrest into your favorite position, which can be precisely recalled using small marks that are molded into the plastic at the pivot points of both the upper arm and lower arm. I have applied a bit of white nail polish to the two marks that correspond to my favorite angle. This way I can open up the stand and click it into the perfect position is under two seconds.The base of the stand is notched, which is where the tablet sits. The notch and the upper arm against which the iPad rests are both padded in a foam. The foam protects the tablet from scuffs, but also provides an amazing grip to the tablet. In fact, I can grab the back of the stand, right where the upper arm bends, and carry around my iPad with it resting on the stand. It's nutty! The foam gives it the stick, but the arms are also constructed in such a way that they firmly click into fixed position, so I am never concerned the arms will slip out of position or collapse - even walking around with my iPad sitting on it. I am impressed that such an inexpensive product can be so well designed. Love this little thing.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Text: This is an amazing gadget.  I can't believe I lived without it till now.  It works for my Paperwhite, my Galaxy 10 tablet, and my iPad.  It folds up easily and fits in my jeans pocket so it can go out to dinner with me.  Was worried at first it might break, but it is very durable and the stiffness of a new product has dissipated.  Totally adjustable so I can have different angles for different uses.  I frequently cook using my tablets, and I want them at a different angle than I need my Paperwhite for reading.  I just wish I had invented this.  From the reviewsl I thought it would be different from the Arkon, which I also ordered.  Except for the Amazon Basics logo it seems identical.  Perfect, since my husband was really wanting one too.  Since I ordered one of each, he didn't have to wait for his to arrive.

Name: Stephanie Berry
Review Title: WOULD BUY THIS PRODUCT ALL OVER AGAIN! Sturdy, stable & versatile!
Review Text: This phone / tablet stand is DEFINITELY sturdy, stable and versatile! It's not only holds my heavy and thick tablet, but it also holds a thinner phone. You can use it in either portrait or landscape mode and it has a silicone backing that prohibits your phone or your tablet from slipping. If I had to buy another stand, I would go with this product all over again.

Name: Eric Baum
Review Title: Very well thought out product and at a great price point
Review Text: This stand is well constructed and well designed. I have a 12 inch tablet I use as a second monitor on my laptop.  I have to set my station up at work every day and this stand gets packed in and out with me every day.  It's compact enough to fit in a side pocket of my backpack, yet folds out to a size that will accommodate my large tablet.My tablet feels secure in its cradle and I have complete adjustment capabilities as well.Very well thought out product and at a great price point.

Name: dutchw48Top Contributor: Drawing
Review Title: Simple design produces an elegant tool.
Review Text: It surprising, when you unpack this stand, to watch its transformation from a compact rectangular box into a very practical stand that is solidly made and very functional. I have even used this with my Fire 10HD on top of my bed! It is stable and sturdy and stands firm as I pound the screen playing Texas Hold'em. Kudos!

Name: ndcColorado
Review Text: This stand is just what we were looking for, to use with my daughters Kurio X-treme 7 inch tablet! It is easy to adjust to different angles. She had tried other stands, and was not ever able to get the angle right.  It is also very easy to adjust, so if we want to use the tablet together, we can adjust it so I can see the screen.  My daughter loves playing the motion (camera) activated games, and this allows her to do so with very good results, since she can adjust it so that the camera can see her, and she can have a good angle to see the screen.  We have only had it for a couple of weeks, but it seems to be very durable, and I don't worry about it breaking easily. Even if it does, it is at a very affordable price, and I wouldn't hesitate to buy another.

Name: Erkle
Review Title: Sturdy holds ipad well, apple charger cable a challenge
Review Text: Sturdy holds ipad well, however the apple charger cable doesn't fit well. It pushes the ipad up and out of the grooves to hold the ipad. It ends up the cable is very kinked to fit on a hard surface.The unit needs about 1/4" more height to allow use of apple lightning charger cable or accessory cable.

Name: A. Henning
Review Title: Completely Adjustable to Suit Your Needs
Review Text: I am amazed at the cleverness of this product.  It seems to be nearly 100% adjustable with no limitations.  Believe me, I am super fussy and nitpicky.  I needed something that would hold my tablet at just shy of a 90Â° angle for bedside viewing.  This does it, with the added bonus of being able to loop the hand strap over the top arm...just in case I knock it...it won't fall forward.  LOVE it and so happy with my purchase!

Name: Jesse K.
Review Text: It works well. . Used frequently for textbook reading. Great price and it folds up nicely. I was unsure of whether it would hold up my new surface pro 7 in portrait mode, and it does. For the surface pro in portrait, you Can't lean it back too far or it'll be unstable and you should mind the heavy side (battery) but it holds up well for the surface pro if you pay attention to those details. .

Name: ejbleen
Review Text: I use this stand to prop up an iPad Air on a midi keyboard with a surface that slopes slightly forward. I can then read music from the iPad. The stand replaced a sturdy but enormous music stand that stood behind the keyboard. The Amazon stand brings the iPad further forward to just the right position.I would have expected this item to be double the price. I have bought some other Amazon-branded stuff and most of it has turned out well. This, though, knocks it out of the park.

Name: J. Rosenbaum
Review Text: Great Stand for iPad Pro 12.9. Great for travel. Easy to adjust. I gave it 3 stars because after 2 months the rubber padding under the stand came off.  The padding is very important to prevent the stand from slipping and thus potentially damaging the iPad.  I used tape to keep the padding intact for now.  For $8.95 this is expected. I will probably order another one in the future when my current stand falls apart.  There is the Compass 2 which is recommended by Wirecutter, but at $57, seems expensive for what it is.

Name: DPM
Review Title: Good Choice for Smaller Fire Tablets
Review Text: I use this for my Fire 8.  It supports vertical and horizontal orientations for reading and typing.  Very simple hard plastic that is easy to use.  It seems sturdy with the Kindle inserted.  Good price.  I use the case with the folding cover stand for my larger Fire 10.  This stand would probably be fine as well.

Name: Aaron Theodore
Review Text: What a great little stand. It was inexpensive but does not seem cheap. I use it with my iPad Pro 10.5" and it works very well.It was even kinda fun to set it up because it opens up like a transforming toy from the 80's.I frequently change the orientation of the iPad while I use it, and this little stand lets me do that without fuss.

Name: Lonelydad
Review Text: I eat out on a regular basis, and being alone, I usually am reading on my tablet while I eat. I got real tired of holding my tablet with one hand and eating with the other, and decided to do something about it. After doing some research, I settled on this stand as the one that seemed to meet my needs and be the most value for the dollar. I was right. Folded up, it is small enough to slip into a back pocket (but take it out before sitting down!), and folds out easily when needed. I can set just the right angle for reading, and the joints are stiff enough they are not going to be changed by an accidental bump. I now can enjoy my meals as I should without having to set my tablet down from time to time when both hands are needed. This is definitely a keeper.

Name: reesah mouse
Review Title: Great for the iPad (big or small) and for the Kindle
Review Text: I bought this to use with my iPad Mini, because the Smart Cover for the Mini is not very stable when in the upright position, but I actually use it most for my iPad 3 instead. I have a Smart Cover for the big iPad (as well as a back cover), but I like the stability of this stand. When I want my iPad upright on my desk or on the kitchen table or any other stable, flat surface,* this stand allows me to have my iPad at the exact angle that's best for viewing and touching and not seeing glare on the screen. This stand works perfectly with the iPad 3, but I've also used it with the iPad Mini (which I have in aÂ Speck Products FitFolio Protective Cover for iPad mini - FreshBloom Coral Pink (SPK-A1523)  ) and with my Kindle Paperwhite (which I have inÂ Marware jurni Kindle Case Cover, Blue (fits Kindle Paperwhite, Kindle, and Kindle Touch)  ). All three fit on this stand without removing them from their cases. The Kindle rests maybe a bit less stable in this stand without removing it from the case, but it works.I highly recommend this stand even if you have a Smart Cover or another cover that can be used as a stand.*When using my iPad on a surface that is not flat, I often useÂ Peeramid Bookrest Pillow- Red  Â (mine is blue).

Name: Pat Z
Review Text: I have tried several tablet holders in the past and none of them hold up my iPad as well as this one.  Granted, this is not a carrying case but for use around the house, you can't beat it.  Easily switch from landscape to portrait, doesn't topple or slide like others.  Can change the viewing angle in a multitude of choices. I keep my iPad in a case when not on the stand.

Name: Techno-Mom
Review Title: Mechanically excellent, but Foam bottom stuck to the counter.
Review Text: This works very well, and mechanically, I couldn't be happier.....but it was on the kitchen counter while using the tablet for a recipe and something made the dense foam feet bottom pads stick (heat?) to the counter. When I picked it up, it ripped a foam layer off that was - oh myyy - stick to the counter!I had to get a razor blade to scrape it off. The foam bottom things are great for not scratching a surface, but I totally did not expect that it would meld itself into the counter. It was not super hot, either, because the tablet would have been damaged as well had it gotten really hot, so I don't know why it did that. There was nothing else on the counter (no detergents), either. I use it everywhere I read the tablet, so who knows what caused it. The foam does help on an uneven/bumpy surface, but thick felt might be a better choice.

Name: Thomas Baldovin
Review Text: I recently bought a few of these but I have actually owned one for several years.  It is sturdy, not likely to slip or collapse, and is very adjustable to different size devices.  I use it for different tablets including a Kindle 10, generation 11 and my android phone.  I highly recommend this.

Name: Ryan Kennedy
Review Title: Bought a second one after 6 years
Review Text: I bought this 6 years ago for 5 dollars, it lasted forever with nightly use, supports my tablet,  adjustable depending on how I'm laying in bed or studying, or cooking with recipes. The cushions fell off after about 2 years of use. Surprised at the cost increase but it's such a good product I am happy to get it again.

Name: Thomas L.
Review Title: Show Mode? More like D'oh! Mode, amirite? This stand fixes it.
Review Text: I love the Kindle Fire HD's Show Mode, but I hate it that Show Mode isn't orientation-sensitive. Show Mode only displays an orientation that assumes switches are on the right.  Lame development decision. My tablet's protective case is designed to prop up the tablet with the top switches on the left in landscape mode. This foldable little stand lets me prop up the tablet and conform to Show Mode's neediness at the same time!

Name: Antony P
Review Text: Small, sturdy, holds the Ipad pro 12.9 inch ok. There is wobble if you press on it so this wouldn't be good for a drawing stand.The major DESIGN FLAW is the angle at which the feet cradles are cut. The iPad's point of contact is very very small even though it could be about a half an inch. Essentially the grooves are not parallel with the backrest. If this was fixed it would lead to greater longevity and tablet stability, I don't know how they missed this.UPDATE: WITH A LITTLE EFFORT THE FEET OPEN WIDER. I THOUGHT IT WAS BREAKING BUT NOPE! PERFECT ALIGNMENT.

Name: Jill
Review Text: This stand does just what it is advertised as.  You can put your iPad or Kindle type device vertically or horizontally and adjust it to virtually any incline you want.  I've used it for several months now and it is working great - not loosening up like other stands I have.  The quality is very nice. The rubbery pieces in the indents on the bottom legs hold the device steady and you can poke away at the screen without the device falling over.  I also like that it folds up small enough and is light enough to fit in even a small case.I use this in the kitchen as a 'book stand' to see my recipes, or watch a youtube video.  It can also be used with a bluetooth keyboard to hold your screen at an optimal angle.

Name: DIANE L KLEPAL
Review Text: I have a small stand with no â€œbackâ€ support and my phone with the case does not fit in the notches you hold phone.  This stand is perfect and you can really adjust it to any position.  Works perfect for when Iâ€™m FaceTiming or watching a video.

Name: Unknown
Review Title: Works great with devices in cases
Review Text: This is such a great little accessory for my iPad and iPhone 11.  They both are in cases and fit well in the slots at the feet.  I really like all the ways you can adjust this to get the best angle and height. It's quite sturdy  It takes up very little space, and it's easy to take and use anywhere.  I highly recommend this.

Name: Lora H
Review Text: I had all kinds of thoughts of how to have something made to do exactly what this holder will do for my Kindle ereader.  I can get it at the perfect angle to read at a table while eating alone at home or in some restaurants for lunch.  It's light but with good grips where needed, fold it and toss it in my purse when I'm finished and I'm out the door.  I LOVE my Kindle and I'm always treated the best by Amazon.I also tried out holding my grandson's iPad on it and it worked just as well with a couple clicks to adjust the width. I see it's had a price increase in the few days since I bought.  ;)

Name: LMcMa
Review Text: Bought this to hold my first graderâ€™s iPad mini for zoom calls. Wasnâ€™t sure how good it would be because it was inexpensive - this is awesome! Easy to adjust for angle and can be used landscape or portrait. She can adjust it herself which is a plus. Doesnâ€™t slip on the table, very sturdy and well made. Rare 5 stars!!

Name: Wiley
Review Title: Almost perfect, almost.  With my tablet, this stand has a problem that requires a minor compromise.
Review Text: Well, this stand is certainly worth every penny I paid for it.  The construction and ease of use is great for the most part.  However, with a 10.5" tablet, it seems to not quite adjust to the right angle in either horizontal or vertical orientation.  Note the picture that illustrates the product in use.  That is the problem!  It wants to support the device when it is laying way back.  The back support does not accurately support the back until it gets to that angle.  I elected to hold on to the stand after I discovered I could live with the support articulation issue.  What I wanted from the stand was for it to securely hold the device in a more upright orientation, thereby reducing overhead lighting reflection.  I can use this stand as is, but if I had been able to try it out first, I probably would have kept shopping.  Thankfully, the cost of the stand is a good incentive to buy before you try.

Name: TREEHOUSE
Review Title: Works but wish has better plastic material.
Review Text: The design and function work really well to give an iPad a better viewing angles. The plastic material used can be a higher grade in my opinion, but it's not so cheap that you worry it will break.

Name: Eddie Towles
Review Text: It was everything I expected and more. A great product to have with my Kindle Fire HD 8 as a stand.  This is one of the best stands I have ever owned.  It is so adjustable it will just about work on any type of tablet or phone.  Just amazing and I give it 5 stars in a heartbeat.  One of the best of the best by far.  Absolutely no complaints what so ever on this stand.

Name: LassieM
Review Text: This stand is inexpensive and works well.  It gives a greater range of possible positions than a more expensive one I bought.  I use the stand for two activities.  One is using the IPad for hours while sitting at a desk.  I can get the IPad at an angle that prevents the neck pain I get from having the IPad horizontal.  I have also used the stand for a Zoom meeting, for which you need a vertical screen.  The stand lets you get your screen almost vertical, unlike my more expensive brand.  For Zoom, you need to put the stand on top of something, to get your screen to face level.

Name: Amberaa1
Review Title: Sturdy stand, fits with my case on my S7 11"
Review Text: This fits my S7 perfectly! And to think I was getting ready to buy a much more expensive one. My case already has a stand on it, but on the plane I don't believe it sets back far enough for us both to watch. This is very sturdy, I was expecting it to be a little shaky but it looks great as you can see. Even with my heavy duty case that's an A++

Name: Purchaser45BK
Review Title: Get this stand if you have $10 to spare
Review Text: I recently purchased the ASUS MB169+ portable monitor because I tend to work remotely a lot or at home and having dual screens makes me a lot more efficient. However, the stand that comes with the monitor takes a lot of space and doesnâ€™t provide you with many options to angle the monitor. I then decided to look for another stand and noticed that this tablet stand was often paired with the monitor.Iâ€™ll admit that I was a bit skeptical given the sticker price of $9.79 (tax included) but thought it wouldnâ€™t be a huge loss if the product is defective. I am very pleased to say that I was entirely wrong about this product; the value proposition on this item is huge.First, the compact design makes this stand not only easy to carry in a backpack or laptop bag but also small enough to carry in your pocket. Second, this stand is versatile which you can use for a monitor, laptop, or cell phone for quick and easy use or view pleasure (I like to watch anime while I cook).For ~$10 this product is worth every cent and I definitely recommend that you considering purchasing this item if you need a small stand.Attached are some pictures to help you with your decision.

Name: Rachel Sandhaus
Review Text: I read so much that holding a book or kindle for long periods of time makes my hand/wrist/elbow hurt. Having switched mostly to reading on a kindle I was looking for a stand to make it easy to read without holding the device. This fits the bill perfectly - I can use it on the arm of the couch, the table, the pool deck, even in bed resting on my chest. Easily adjustable, I even use it to hold and scroll through my phone.
