Name: Anne Glubis Gmail acct
Review Text: I just got it and couldn't get onto Amazon fast enough to rate it.  I have a portable monitor that comes with a case that is supposed to flip into a stand; and it is a headache.  This stand I just received took me forever to find and IT IS PERFECT!  It's more sturdy than it looks in the ad and can hold a much bigger screen than they are advertising.  My portable monitor is 15" i think (larger than my laptop screen) and it is now nicely situated next to me.  Gotta go onto the monitor ad and let people know about this!

Name: Krystal
Review Text: I love this. I purchased afterI have surgery and needed it so that I could see my Kindle on.my lap table. Then we flew to AZ and it was perfect to use on the plane!!! I will be brining this everytime I fly now!! I would rather watch movies on.my tablet than have to bring my laptop onto the plane.

Name: M. Cosner
Review Title: Don't buy this if you use an app that REQUIRES you to use your tablet in the default orientation
Review Text: Unfortunately, I have an app I use daily that doesn't adjust orientation when you flip the tablet upside down.  Because of this, the stand is inconvenient since there isn't enough ground clearance for the charger plug.  In every other orientation the stand works well enough, just not for my specific need.

Name: Heathah
Review Title: Perfect portable stand for an iPad
Review Text: Going on a flight and I wanted a portable, low-cost stand for my iPad to watch movies on the plane. I absolutely love this stand and have started using it for other things too leading up to the flight. iPad doesnâ€™t budge a bit even with a nosy puppy nudging at it. Very portable and easy to configure into any position you want. Grips on the bottom and on the parts that make contact with the iPad keep things from slipping. I searched through a ton of different options for stands and canâ€™t imagine a stand better suited for my need!

Name: The Grubb Show
Review Title: You can do better, if you just need a cheap fix, then your golden here
Review Text: Honestly don't waste your money on this one. It is cheap for a reason.  Mine is hard to spread the legs/arms to any usable postion and just does not hold the device in the position and angle that you need.  I love Amazon and most of their Basic line of products have been great, this one just needs a little more love by the designers.This may be useful if you need a cheap fix for travel purposes.

Name: D. C.
Review Title: Finally found the best tablet stand for my toshiba tribe tablet
Review Text: Finally found the best tablet stand for my toshiba tribe tablet, my toshiba tablet is very heavy, and I had trouble finding the right tablet holder, then, I  realized, I needed a tablet stand, not a holder, because of it's weight.  Found this foldable, portable tablet stand that was perfect for my needs,fit perfect on my stand, highly recommend it, my Toshiba Tribe is about 5/8 inches thick and very heavy, fit perfect on this stand., Big thumbs up.

Name: aprildoggie
Review Title: only fits new fire 10 if you take the kindle out of its cover
Review Text: I never take the cover off my fire tablet for obvious reasons.  So, I am very disappointed my kindle does not fit into the slots of the stand unless I remove the protective cover.  I can set the kindle on top of the slots at bottom of stand, but not into the slots.  This reduces stability.  Well made product, just not great for the new 10 inch fire tablet.

Name: rhannig
Review Text: I love this little guy! Yes, it's wood and lightweight, but it does the trick. I can fold it up and put it in my purse. I've used it for my phone and Samson Tab4 tablet. It's sturdy enough for me and the price it right. I've had no problem with it. Adjustable and looks great.

Name: SK8LADY
Review Title: SHOULD BE STANDARD EQUIPMENT FOR THE KINDLE FIRE!
Review Text: Couldn't live without it!  I'm not sure how I ever used my Kindle without this little gadget.  I read while eating my breakfast before work and I would try different items in the kitchen to "prop" my Kindle up for easier reading. I have the Kindle Fire 8.9" tablet so it's rather heavy and hard to keep stable on a slick countertop surface.  I have tried different covers with kickstands and folding covers that kept my Kindle upright but they added so much bulk to my Kindle that I couldn't carry it in my purse with the case on.  This tablet stand is the ticket!  Great product and a great price too.  No slippage on the counter and it's fully adjustable for different light/glare conditions.  I also use it as a tripod for when I need to take a group picture with my Kindle Fire.

Name: Warren A. Slaughter
Review Title: A nice, compact support for your tablet
Review Text: Folds to a very compact size, legs and backrest can be adjusted to accommodate a wide variety of tablets or smart phones, whether in landscape or portrait mode. The rubber feet provide lots of stability, and the rubberized base notches and backrest hold the device securely.

Name: PRdame
Review Text: My 2 year old is always propping his tablet up against stuff so that he can watch his kiddie videos so I thought I'd get him a stand. After doing some research I realized that there aren't very many choices and opted on this one though I had reservations. Of course it's too complicated for my son and he's much more interested in playing with the contraption than for its intended purpose.It seems sturdy, but the joints are stiff and it takes a bit of force to manipulate it. Though it's not difficult to set it's definitely a set it and forget it type of produt. It's a bit cumbersome. I bought this knowing that it's a product intended for adults, but even I  would think twice about buying this again. I feel like I'm playing with Voltron when using it.

Name: Rob
Review Title: Gets the job done, versatile, not fancy but functional
Review Text: Functional, gets the job done. Wish it was a bit heavier or heftier. It is made with relatively light plastic material. My kids often play around with it as if it is a toy, and throw it around, I never know where it is, lol. If it was heavier, that would happen less probably. (Though it would cost more I'm sure)

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Good sturdy design with quality and flexibility in mind.
Review Text: Nice and stable. Great design seems to be made with quality in mind. But be aware if the surface you set the stand on is not level the tablet will slide right off. I found this out the hard way but luckily the tablet survived its tumble with only a minor headache it's not resting in the corner

Name: The Scribe
Review Text: Great product... you don't think it's necessary until you try it... and then you can't do without it.  Durable hard, hard plastic with equally durable joint functions.  Want to read while you're eating ?  This is the item for you.  Want to pet your cat while watching a movie?  This is the item for you. Need to compare notes from a website versus what's on your paper text? This is the item for you...I could go on and on about the possible uses for this stand. Suffice it to say that you won't find a better contraption anywhere.  Plus you'll look mighty silly leaning your tablet against the wall.  Highly... Highly Recommended !!!

Name: S. Dunham
Review Text: I've been looking for a stand for my DX. I had the M-Edge Flex stand for my K2 and K3 but the DX version was DC'd. I recently got a Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for my husband. He likes to use it in landscape mode. The cover has a little rubber tab but that doesn't always keep the Kindle upright. I bought one for him and one for me. I love it! It's perfect for any kind of Kindle. You can use it with the Kindle still in its cover.I feel it's sturdy and well made. I saw a few negative reviews that stated this was cheaply made. I so disagree. I just think that some people are heavy handed and probably have a tendancy of breaking a lot of things. I'm sure there might be a defective product here and there. Amazon stands behind their products and will replace or return your money if you're not satisfied.It's light weight, durable, portable, and inexpensive. If you are looking for a stand for your Kindle or Kindle Fire, this is perfect.

Name: Sheli  Bea
Review Title: Love this little gadget! Whoever came up with this idea - thanks a bunch!
Review Text: Works great for my Fire tablet and smartphone. Especially like the adjustable feature which allows me to angle my tablet or phone for personal comfort wherever I use it. Also like the fact that this product allows total view and use of the tablet in bottom area.  Super easy to adjust and while I have not yet folded it up for traveling convenience, that aspect will certainly be appreciated when I fly thither and yon to visit the kids!.

Name: Coloradofamily
Review Text: I am not sure every item on Amazon really needs a review...but what the heck! This is a stand that can be used for Ipad, books, or other small flat items with the similar dimensions. It has several movable joints to you can flex the stand into a position that best suits your display. I use these for software displaying on tablets during trade shows. Good buy!

Name: Gerardo
Review Title: It does exactly what it was designed to accomplish
Review Text: The product does the job as advertised. I wanted to put my ipad on the top of my studio piano so I could read sheet music without tilting my head down at all. I can do that now. The stand is not expensive and does the job as was described in the information on the Amazon web page.

Name: solocanoe
Review Title: totally 5 stars - holds a lot of things
Review Text: I like how it's pretty small when folded up...holds the Kindle 8th gen ROCK SOLID with ZERO movement on a few different surfaces I've tried it on.Also holds phones, tablets, and even notebooks and papers (ie...when typing and referencing other papers and forms)Totally 5 stars Amazon - thanks for making it - and making it available Prime.

Name: Mike B Sr.
Review Text: Great tablet stand for my new Fire 8 HD.  Works perfectly holding the tablet very stable. Seems to be fairly well made even tho it's all plastic,makes it lite weight for easy carry. It's a flash to set exactly at the angle you prefer to view your tablet. Plus thin enough it easily fit in my hard case for my tablet for storage and carrying. For the price and level of construction I think it is a overall good deal and recommend it to anyone with similar needs.

Name: S Brave
Review Text: This thing is amazing. I bought a case without the built in stand for an ipad 3 and  realized it was not ideal for situations when i wanted to prop it up. I found this stand and although the case is pretty thick and bulky on the ipad 3 it works marvelously with it. It has a lot of positions you can bend it to. Holds good weight and is not flimsy. The rubber padding holds the device very well, i did the shake test and it did not budge. You also don't have to worry about any sharp edges damaging your devices. It will hold my ipad in landscape or portrait view. I'm pretty I will be using it with all my other devices too (kindle paperwhite, kindle fire...) If you want a multipurpose stand I highly recommend it.

Name: Adrian
Review Title: It does what it's supposed to and it does it well!
Review Text: I purchased this for when I want to use my Bluetooth keyboard with my tablet and I don't want to be holding the tablet up with my hands. It does a solid job at holding up the tablet, and it can be adjusted to whatever angle is best for you. It has grips on the bottom so it won't move easily or slide around on the table.

Name: abl9999
Review Title: This holds it in place really well with a non slip type of rubberized like surface on the bottom of it and the top ...
Review Text: I was really impressed with this small, but heavy duty plastic holder for small ipad.  This holds it in place really well with a non slip type of rubberized like surface on the bottom of it and the top piece holds the ipad in place without moving. It adjusts to a lot of different positions to lay the ipad back far or have it sit up more straight and in your face. I really like it so much, I just bought another one this weekend for my other bigger Samsung Ipad. I had to make sure it would hold a bigger one and it did. Great product for the price. Money well spent on this item.

Name: RLJ
Review Text: Bought this for my 9 year old son.  He has a Samsung Galaxy tablet.  I believe he has the 7 inch screen.  This stand is built very well and sturdy.  It holds his tablet perfectly and securely in place.  It folds up nice and neat when not in use.  You can easily take it with you in a pocket. When you need to use it just open it up to the correct position and it holds your tablet perfectly.  It will most likely only work on flat surfaces or table tops.  I wouldn't think it would be to great to use on a bed or pillow or uneven surface.  However my kid loves it and it's well worth the price. I would recommend this item to anyone looking for a good stand for their small tablet.

Name: Boatwaco
Review Title: Works very well as a tablet stand
Review Text: Works with our kidâ€™s Fire 8 and also can be used with iPhone. Itâ€™s adjustable enough, but you need some real estate on the table for it to sit. We have used it on a high chairâ€™s food tray, and on a restaurant table. It functions great, stores compactly but it takes up room.

Name: BusyMom
Review Text: This is a really great tablet stand. I'm currently using it with an Amazon Fire 8HD in a case, although it works for tablets without a case too. It can be adjusted to hold tablets in any position: landscape or portrait, and tilts to nearly any angle. It folds up small enough to toss in a purse or backpack. The nonskid bottom keeps the tablet from sliding around on the desk while using the touch screen. The price was pretty great, too!

Name: Johnny
Review Text: I purchased this as a test to see whether it would support a rugged, Class 1 Division 2, industrial tablet which is considerably thicker and heavier than an iPad or any standard Android tablet. This tablet stand works wonders. I'm about to order 4 more for my co-workers.Will easily support any iOS or Android tablet tablet, regardless of size or weight, as well.It's also designed to be 'folded up' and it fits into my laptop bag with ease.Elegant design. Extremely versatile. Ridiculously inexpensive. As close to perfect as it gets for it's purpose..

Name: Mike Satke
Review Title: I bought this because I like reading while eating lunch at my desk
Review Text: I bought this because I like reading while eating lunch at my desk.  In the past I've used a Lucite stand for decorative plates to support my Kindles.  This is a definite raise in pay over that arrangement.  My first Kindle was the second gen model.  I'd bought a Belkin soft case for it, because it had storage for the charging cord and the reading lamp.  I've resurrected it for use with my new Fire as I can carry all my peripherals along with my Fire in one spot.  This adjustable stand, when folded, fits perfectly in the storage compartment with the car charge plug, the wall charge plug, the cord, and ear phones.The stand itself, is very sturdy, and the pads on the base prevent movement on any surface.  I'll get more of these for my wife and daughter.I very good product.

Name: KAY
Review Text: This stand is perfect. It is compact and lightweight. The feature I like the most is the adjustable arm (to prod tablet upright) that allows me to change the angle of elevation when overhead lights are on.  I use this stand with my Dell Venue 11 tablet that weighs 1lb. The stand feels ever so slightly unsteady with the Dell in place, but the stand has never flipped over and is very steady when my tablet is in the landscape position. However, I doubt that there would be any unsteadiness if the stand were used and with lighter tablets. The non-slip padding is really non-slip. There is padding in each groove of the base. This stand is truly just what I wanted.

Name: A. Wong
Review Text: The stand works as you'd expect -- it allows the Kindle to stand by itself. The number of angles you can choose from is pretty good. I still haven't run across the situation where I couldn't find an angle that would work for me. The stand itself is padded fairly well, enough that I don't expect the tablet to slip or otherwise get scratched. The build quality is also pretty good for the price -- I don't expect this to break anytime soon. Also, tried this with a 7" Kindle Fire, as well as an 8.9" Kindle Fire -- both work great!

Name: KLDNV
Review Text: The new 10 inch Kindle Fire Origami case doesn't hold  in portrait orientation as well as the 8 incher did. This was my attempt at a solution, and I'm glad I tried it. Easily adjusts for any viewing angle, and folds away small enough to fit in pocket of lunch back.

Name: Kat
Review Title: Doesn't collapse or wear down with a 12 inch tablet
Review Text: I have a large Ipad Pro and most stands will collapse under the weight but not this one. It is incredible and I am so grateful. It works amazingly well when I am using my ipad as a sidecar/second screen. If you are a student who regularly uses both a laptop and tablet simultaneously, get this one. Best stand I have ever had AND it has not worn down with time. 5 stars all around

Name: Heather
Review Title: Great for a phone and smaller tablet
Review Text: Great price works awesome with my 9in ipad and my iphone, vertical and horizontal.  I keep thick protective cases on them and they still fit just fine on the stand.  My husband tried it for his 12 inch iPad and it worked fine horizontal but not vertical,  it would fall back.  I didnâ€™t get it for him though I got it for me and it works just fine for me.

Name: misstrishy
Review Text: This was a great buy. It was affordable & itâ€™s sturdy. Itâ€™s works great even on the bed! Iâ€™m glad I took a chance on this.

Name: Littlduck15
Review Title: Great idea, worked well but broke far too soon
Review Text: I truly liked this device very much, because it made reading and gaming so much easier. However. in less that 2 months, the hinge connecting the legs to the upper prop broke very suddenly, for no apparent reason. The cost of return is does not make it cost effective to return product. I am tempted to purchase another one,  but, am extremely leery of doing so.It seemed very sturdy when I first received it and started to use it. I was totally flabbergasted when it suddenly broke for no apparent reason. Although I found the missing screw to secure the hinge together, it never held again. Oh, well, just my luck to get a dud!

Name: dima
Review Title: You want to get this one over the other metal ones
Review Text: I had the metal one that adjusted by simple moving and it stayed in place due to some sort of friction mechanism. It went bad after a year of constant moving. This will not go bad for many years to come because of the mechanism it uses. It will through constant friction but it will take a few years due to its design.

Name: R. L. Lundeen
Review Title: Fits medium to large smartphones too.
Review Text: Obviously, because I gave it 5 stars, I like it a lot.  It is light and folds up very compact.  I am a musician and I use a tuner app for tuning when I play.  I wanted to use it to hold my iPad and just set it on top of my amp so it's easy to see.  Even though it says tablets and eReaders I was hoping that it would work also for my iPhone 5 and it does.  It fits on the lowest, narrowest settings quite securely.  I would recommend it to others and would definitely buy it again.  For that price, for what does and what it is, it is a steal.

Name: Spooky Boo's Scary Story Time
Review Title: Great stand for reading into a podcast
Review Text: I have a 7-inch Kindle and read my horror stories into it for my podcast. It fits perfectly into the stand and is easy to get to. I wish the Kindle's power was in a different place, but that has nothing to do with the stand. It's sturdy, easy to set up, takes multiple gadget sizes, and if the Kindle's power adapter sat on the other side of the controls the Kindle would be perfect for it.

Name: TJtate
Review Text: It took me a long time to find a proper iPad stand for my personal iPad. This is THE perfect stand. The price, and simplicity on this tablet stand takes the win. Needed this for work using iPad 6th generation. I needed something sturdy and easily portable. Also, enough room to where I can plug in lightening cable if needed.-Easily adjustable-Portable( folds and opens easy to use)-Sturdy( also has notches to hold tablet in place)Thanks

Name: Brendan Donoghue
Review Title: It works for switch lite, tho limited
Review Text: I got this for use with the switch lite to hold it in place so I could use a controller with it. its really meant for something larger but does hold the switch well. in the right configuration. it however is not high enoughe to charge the switch while playing, unless you balance it off the side of a box or table a little bit.

Name: C. Tourtelot
Review Text: I needed a new iPad stand so I thought Iâ€™d give this one a try. Itâ€™s very inexpensive so if I didnâ€™t like it, no big deal.  I have found it to be perfect for my needs. The angle is adjustable. It folds up when not being used. My iPad is in a full case & still fits nicely on stand horizontally or vertically. Iâ€™m very happy with my purchase! (Note: screen size on my iPad is 9.7 inches)

Name: Rishathra
Review Text: It works fine with my 10" Kindle Fire, but with my 12.9" iPad it doesn't even pretend to hold it, just collapses immediately.Otherwise it works as advertised. Well thought out and constructed. The packaging would have to be a toy for gorillas before it got damaged. Folds up into a nice, compact package that is easy to carry and/or store.Bottom line, if you have a small to medium size tablet this will work perfectly for you.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Text: This stand is functional.  The legs on mine are slightly unstable.  I had to move my device a little to counterbalance the wobbly legs to keep the stand stable.  The adjustment detents for the legs seem likely to wear overtime.  If you are going to â€œset it and forget itâ€ Iâ€™m sure it will be fine, but if you intent to fold the stand up repeatedly after use Iâ€™d consider a sturdier more expensive stand.

Name: Harry
Review Text: It's a good stand for tablets and even fablets. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is the foam-like material used for cushioning. Over time it gets "eaten up" or separates from the glue. Maybe some kind of soft rubber should be used for a better durability.

Name: Adam
Review Text: I have been doing a lot of WebEx, Zoom, and FaceTime these days. This works great for virtual meetings on the tablet, but not so much for the iPhone. I know it is just a tablet holder, but a simple adjustment in the first width setting would have made it so much more versatile.

Name: Tristan Ziegler
Review Title: Perfect for the Amazon Kids Kindles!!
Review Text: I bought my niece and nephew each a Kids Kindle for Christmas.  After watching them try to prop their Kindles up onto water bottles, bowls and anything else that would hold them up, I went on an Amazon search for tablet stands for them.  It was hard to find one with a â€œlipâ€ large enough to hold the Kids Kindle in the big protective cases that they come in, but this stand did the job perfectly.  No more spilled cups, no more propping up the tablets on random household items.  I 100% recommend these for use with the Kids Kindles.

Name: Christopher T. Slaterbeck
Review Title: Works with my kindle in bed
Review Text: I put my kindle on it in the landscape position, which means it looks like the portrait position when Iâ€™m laying my head on my pillow.  The legs are far enough apart that it stays firmly placed on my bed, even when I touch the screen to turn the page.  This stand adjusts so it works with larger tablets, too.

Name: finkey
Review Text: My daughter was thrilled to have this stand for her 10-inch tablet, to study e-texts online while at school.  The stand is easy to collapse, carry, and reposition for use.  It makes reading and manipulating the smaller screen easy, stable and comfortable.

Name: mini
Review Text: If you are like me and don't want to spend a ton on an ipad stand, this is a great option. It is very durable and sturdy. It is easy to handle and adjust for your electronic device to fit appropriately. Moreover, it is minimalistic and can be used in almost any room setting.

Name: Der Geek
Review Title: Sturdy, adjustable stand, so should fit a variety of devices.
Review Text: Bought this so I could facetime hands-free and/or watch movies/videos/... while cooking.  Seems adjustable enough to fit an iPad mini (w/out case), a standard iPad even with a relatively bulky case.  I bet it would even double as a stand for a phone if need be.

Name: professor Y
Review Title: Very nice for watching movies on
Review Text: Very nice for watching movies on, super adjustable. Even works for bigger 12.9" ipad. But as a stand to use with my keyboard it is not stable enough to press on - i think i press a bit excitedly. It is just too light to hit the upper corners of the screen with one finger without being very careful. I konw most people won't use it this way. Coincidently i got a fotopro tripod with super flexible legs and i can bend them into a stand which is sturdy. So i'm going to use that instead.

Name: D. Thompson
Review Title: One of the best things I have ever bought
Review Text: I have had one for years and this year at the request of my wife and them becoming available again, I ordered two more for my wife and her sister.  Very nicely made and works on a phone or tablet..  Very compact when folded down so it is easy to store.

Name: James M. Johnson
Review Title: works with my Nexus 7 and its portfolio case
Review Text: My Nexus 7 is in a leather portfolio case. Most of the desk stands require you to use a bare tablet;.the notches at the feet won't accommodate the extra thickness of an open portfolio cover. This one does work better than most in that regard. It also works equally well whether the tablet is in vertical or horizontal mode, and has enough space under the tablet  to accommodate a bottom USB connection.Why didn't I give it 5 stars? It is a bit funky to adjust and therefore better suited to a fixed location than for travel where you will be setting it up and storing it frequently. And funky aside, frankly I don't trust all the plastic friction joints to stand up to day in and day out repeated adjustments. Still it is inexpensive enough to justify periodic replacement should my fears come true.

Name: Carmen Salvino
Review Text: It has a basic purpose and does the job nicely. Perfect for holding up electronic devices at a viewable angle. Has a nice non-slip surface at the bottom to keep it from moving. I've only used it for my phone and my 8" screen size Kindle.  I have not used it for anything larger than that, but I think it would still be ok for larger items. (just a guess).

Name: M. R. Chobanian
Review Title: It does what Ihired it to dounfolds easily snd supports my old(original ipad fine next I'll pair ...
Review Text: It does what Ihired it to dounfolds easily snd supports my old(original ipad fine next I'll pair my rubberised blue tooth keyboard and have the near equivalent of a very portable laptop for travel The Amazon basics line has another inexpensive winner. As another reviewer pointed out it's not titanium , but if it were, the cosr would be four times higher

Name: Carmen
Review Title: Good for personal use and as a gift.
Review Text: I have a 12" tablet that I like to watch my movies on.  I was searching for a device that would be able to handle something larger than the usual 10" tablet, and this turned out to be perfect.  It works well for my smaller device as well, but I generally leave the large tablet on it all the time.  And it was priced very well, which made it even a better buy!

Name: J. Archer
Review Text: I use my iPad as an emergency backup for online ESL teaching. This sturdy little stand easily stays in a drawer until needed. Then I easily, quickly deploy it when needed. Iâ€™ve also used it to hold signs, small whiteboards, and misc. proppable things.

Name: Chicago Mom
Review Title: Works with more than just my iPad
Review Text: I have several of these throughout my house.I have one in my travel bag ready to go at any time.I use these for not only my iPad but also to hold my phone, book, sheet of paper when keying while using my laptop.The uses are endless.

Name: vic
Review Title: foam like area poor peels within a week of use
Review Text: it works and its flexible except it comes with foam like material on the bottom and where it makes contact with the ipad and it started peeling within a week not its all peeled and uneven only reason I am not recommeding this product  I already needing to buy another brand I don't  have it for not even month

Name: lazylegs
Review Title: This is a great little stand!
Review Text: We bought this for our tablet.  It is adjustable so your device can be in almost any position (straight up and down or nearly flat, and everything in between).  I often move the stand with the tablet seated in it (to wipe down the counter it sits on) and it is very sturdy feeling while in the stand, and I don't fear the tablet will fall out while moving it.

Name: Kailak
Review Title: It is stable but device won't be
Review Text: Pros: flexibility and durability of the item itselfCons:1. Tippy with 10" tablets in vertical orientation2. Front edge should be taller to help prevent item from falling forward when device is set to hold phone or tablet nearly vertical

Name: MerryK
Review Title: Handy little critter now just for your Ipad or Kindle
Review Text: This is actually a display stand for anything.  I belong to a writing group, and this item is about the size of a shortish fattish square stick when unfolded.  It is light and can tossed into your backpack and it takes up little to no room.  I use it for all sorts of occasions that requiring a propping up of something.

Name: Tim Williams
Review Title: Adjusts to hold any device in any position
Review Text: I love these little stands. I've bought a bunch of them. I use them for phones, tablets, readers, even an extra laptop monitor. Easy to adjust to fit different size devices and angle them as needed. Sturdy stands up to travel well, I've lost one but haven't broke one yet.

Name: js
Review Title: Adjusts to Any Angle you need !!
Review Text: I thought this stand was Fantastic!!  I had bought cheapie $10 one from Walmart that was piece of you know what, so to find this Amazingly Versatile stand UNDER $10 was Awesome!!Works great, adjusts to any angle I need, holds tablet in place for movie watching n more!  Been showing off to friends n recommending it all!

Name: lele4aday
Review Text: I brought this adjustable stand for my Samsung tablet so when my grandbabies or I watch the tablet for a long time our arms won't get tired holding the tablet. This stand is not to big n u can adjust it for small tablets or a phone. It's easy enough for small children to use. I love using it in bed n I can rotate my tablet to a better view. I really like this product.

Name: RG
Review Text: More than I expected. It feels very durable and has a plethora of angles for my 10in tablet in vertical or landscape mode. I needed it to hold my tablet steady on a table or desk for conference calls. I can't see this being very usable lounging in a chair or in the bed. This is the best amazonbasics product I bought thus far!

Name: Dean
Review Text: Works well with my 10 inch fire tablet.  Vertical or horizontal position without adjusting stand in position I have it in.  Sturdy enough doesn't tip easily if bumped or screen touched hard.  Only concern is foam pads for tablet trip but more so those for table trip will possibly detach, move or wear out.  But at this price, would replace with the same.

Name: Susan ATop Contributor: Nail Art
Review Text: The item was just as described by seller. This is a great little tablet stand. I was worried about its size that it would tip over easy, especially when I felt how lightweight it was, but so far (2 months usage) it hasn't. It's mainly used with a mini tablet & works excellent with it, but I have used my full sized tablet with it without issue as well. Love that it's so adjustable. Would buy again.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Text: The rubber padding/tape on the bottom came off after a couple months.  Looking at the way it was designed, it's almost as if it was intentionally designed to fail.  For that, one star.If the tape hadn't failed, I would have given it five.

Name: kbslc
Review Title: Fabulous to have for my art work.
Review Text: Often I work from photos that I have taken.  I do watercolors and it is nice to be able to prop up the iPad and have the photo right there.  I can even expand to do close up.  Love the stand as it is light and certainly packable with supplies.

Name: Beverly R. White
Review Text: Great Buy!!!THIS IS THE BEST LITTLE GADGET I'VE EVER BOUGHT BEFORE. THIS COMES IN HANDY SO MANY TIMES. I AM A CHAPLAIN AND THERE ARE TIMES WHEN A PATIENT WANTS TO VIDEO CHAT WITH THEIR FAMILY. I'M ABLE TO SET IT UP USING MY STAND, LEAVE THE ROOM AND EVERYTHING'S JUST FINE. LOVE IT

Name: DASH
Review Text: Love being able to use for video chats. This keeps my iPad upright for video calls and doesnâ€™t take up a lot of space. I also like to use it for watching other shows on the iPad. In addition, it folds up very small for storing. Great value and works perfectly for my needs.

Name: ChristopherT
Review Title: Awesome little stand for my huge tablet
Review Text: I bought this as a way to make my 18.3" Samsung Galaxy View tablet able to fit in my pack.  I popped off the factory stand, and bought this little folding one.  You can tell it isn't intended for a tablet this large and heavy, but if you get the vertical section adjusted just right, it works pretty good.  The stand will rock a little if you press too hard on the power button, but that is minor.  A great, very portable little stand, for less than 10 bucks, and it came in the best packaging I have ever seen.

Name: Sharon
Review Title: Perfect product.  Basic, sturdy, does exactly what I want at a great price
Review Text: I set it up for my wife to use with her mini IPad for Zoom meetings.  Opened the box, unfolded the compact design and it was ready in minutes.  I love the way it can be almost vertical yet still stable.  The slots in bottom legs seem to be what ensures it does not fold over.  As my wife is short, I put it on a couple of large fat books so that it could show her face without distortion.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Text: Perfect little stand to support my tablet when I need a recipe in the kitchen. It also holds my phone when I am videoing with my children. Definitely worth the $10 I paid for it. Such a simple thing and I get so much use out of it! I highly recommend it! Would love to share a photo, but will not give Amazon access to my photo gallery.

Name: D. Greenlaw
Review Text: We got this for my son, and he said it was not stable so he returned it and got a different one.

Name: Keith Z.
Review Text: I own 3 of these and also bought some for family members they are a perfect stand for my iPhone iPad and portable monitor. Stand is strong and has positive click in positions for both the legs and the back support so you can set it up to be super stable and adjust the angle of your screen super easily

Name: M. Veloso
Review Title: Bought 4, they're great around the house.
Review Text: These tablet stands are surprisingly useful. I've bought four and leave them around the house. It's easier to use these than trying to fold my iPad case into the correct orientation. Plus the angle is easy to adjust for both portrait and landscape orientation. What's not to like about these?

Name: catmamabritishstoryreader
Review Text: This does work for my Nook.  It is sturdy and it is adjustable to hold something wider.  It does take up more room lengthwise than I would like though.  Also, one of the legs is quite stiff.  When I first opened it, I thought I was going to break it.

Name: Mike Newman
Review Text: This stand works well with larger tablets, somewhere around the 10 inch size.  However, when you take a 7 inch tablet and put in on the stand in "portrait" it is easier to tip over.  I wouldn't say it's easy to tip over... but it isn't difficult to do either.  It is easy to tip if the tablet is in a case with a flap that folds behind it, like mine.  I got this to use with my Nexus 7 and I --hated-- this stand until Google updated the tablet so that the home screen could rotate to landscape.  A 7-inch tablet in landscape works great, even with a case like mine.So I would say if you have a 10 inch tablet, your good.  If you have a 7 inch tablet and the home screen rotates to allow landscape, your good.  If you have a thick case, a case with fold behind flap, or you want to use your 7 inch tablet in portrait, you may have trouble.Overall for the price, it works well.  It has grippy foam feet and pads that work well.  It is super simple and folds down small for travel.

Name: domingo ftom az
Review Title: works well for the FireHD 10 with an added case
Review Text: Works well and is useful in holding and adjusting the viewing angle of your tablet. Quality is good for the price and while the bottom legs have loosened a bit it hasn't caused any problems. Its pretty lightweight, packable and worth purchasing.

Name: Ethan A.
Review Title: Won't hold a 7 or 10 in tablet level. Piece of junk
Review Text: The headline says it all. This is a 25 cent piece of plastic junk that will not hold either tablet horizontal or vertical. The back is not flush and can't be made to be flush. The base has no grip, the tablet will fall over. Caveat emptor.

Name: Tim C.
Review Text: These are great, versatile and durable tablet stands!  They are not the prettiest thing going, but they fold into a super small package, are super flexible, easy to set up, and work perfectly.  We have several of these now because they work so well and the price is so great it's a huge convenience.  The anti-slip rubber feet on the bottom and that make contact with your tablet are a very thoughtful detail as well, months into use they are showing zero wear - I'm very pleased with these.

Name: John Smith
Review Text: For $9 this is a fine stand. Using it with my Fire 7 tablet as sort of a second screen for when I'm working on my computer. It sits under my monitor allowing me to stream video to it while reducing my work productivity on my main monitor.

Name: Debbie P.
Review Text: This is quite a handy tablet/phone holder. Very versatile as it has no restrictions as to how the tablet can be held. It has the ability to be set in many different angles to accommodate any position of a tablet. So simple, yet so clever and useful.

Name: John Kinsella
Review Title: Great, versatile stand that is also inexpensive!
Review Text: This inexpensive stand adjusts to many sizes of device and holds my Kindle at exactly the angle I want.  Rubber pads on the bottom keep it where you put it and the back support also has a rubber pad that secures the device.  Finally, rubber pads cushion the bottom of the slots at the bottom of the Kindle.  It folds up to a very small size for travel.

Name: Princess & Maciek Sabodacha
Review Title: Itâ€™s stable but the foam on the â€˜footâ€™ started peeling
Review Text: Itâ€™s very sturdy, stable and versatile as I can use it on my iPhone too but the foam on the leg started peeling already and it hasnâ€™t been even a week yet.

Name: Dan
Review Text: Excellent reviews and a helpful video are enough reasons to order this thing. It works well, is sturdy, and fits my retina ipad mini with a bulky Lifeproof Nuud case. The device is very stable but not enough to operate / press the home button with the mentioned case (there is always multi touch gestures I guess).The second problem I ran into is that I have used the stand for 24+ hours and one of the cushioning foam pads already came off on one end. I noticed when the stand started wobbling and wouldn't sit flat.Another minor issue is that such pads are dirt magnets. Again, in a bit more than a day they're already full of debris.I don't hate it but could be better.

Name: B. C. Roberts
Review Text: Simple, versatile, small and effective.  Just a simple little device, but can be configured in a variety of ways to work with just about any device.  Works on our phones, iPads, Kindles, everything.  Can't beat this for the price and simplicity.  Also very sturdy and folds up into a small package.

Name: Ljp
Review Text: Got the holder for reading while eating on my break at work. It works better than I thought. I can change the angle so the light glair is gone.I am goin to get a second one for my kitchen to hold my iPad for when I am cooking.

Name: cube1
Review Title: Useful stand - but not sure how long it will last
Review Text: Got this for my wife to hold her tablet while she reads in bed on her side.  It is very versatile, but like all of these sorts of stands the detents for the leg position are just plastic, and so I expect they will wear a bit over time.

Name: Blargh
Review Text: The tablet stand works perfectly. Though I'm not the least bit aggressive with it in any way. The stand sits there for hours holding the tablet and I don't touch it. If that's your intentions of use then this stand will work for you.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Title: Not as durable after short time use
Review Text: Liked the design the easiness of setting up and folding closed...only thing is pads on lower legs are already shabby and falling off in pieces.I open and close this daily with use and it seems my cover is wearing out those cushions on the leg area..otherwise this is great...Sorry

Name: Gadget Guru
Review Text: This little stand works great for tablets without a built in kickstand, and even for those with a kickstand when you want to hold the tablet vertically.I have a lot of digital manuals and instruction guides on my tablet, so it's nice to have the tablet standing upright where I can read it without having to touch it with messy hands during car repairs and hobby projects. It's also nice to be able to read while I eat my breakfast in the morning without having to crane my neck to see something laying flat on the table.The stand seems to work a bit better with 10" tablets than 7" ones, but it held my 7" Fire without much fuss. It works far better with my 10" Asus Transformer, though.The stand folds up compactly so I can keep it in my bag all the time when not in use.

Name: Bumble B.
Review Text: Sturdy stand. Bought for my kid's distance learning at home during this pandemic situation. My kid gives it thumbs up compared to another more expensive iPad stand we have. iPad does not fell down or move about using this stand when kids press on the screen. For the price, it's a great buy.

Name: Drew Sharp
Review Title: Travel tablet stand tested with 7" to 11.6" Android Tablets
Review Text: Perfict! Just what I need. Works well with most any kind of smartphone or tablet. To show you just how Cool it is - it works well with my Android Smartphone, FIRE HD 7, 8, 10 inch tablets and I've even tried it with 2 in 1 RCA tablets like 11.6 Delta Pro. Best uses include video playing and using a stylus for a paint by numbers app.

Name: Mike
Review Title: Won't stay at the selected angle in vertical with 10" tablet.
Review Text: I have tightened the joint in the middle of the upright arm over and over, and it won't stay at the setting angle I had chosen. As soon as I tap on the screen on the upper 2/3, the joint on the upper arm collapses and the tablet falls backwards.

Name: TruRev
Review Text: For the size, availability and the planned uses, I like this product. It should probably cost a lot less given the material quality. We have iPads with thick cases, so this product was one of the few that worked with the thick case.

Name: Suzanne or Jean-Paul Richard
Review Text: I know that I was using it a lot and often having to adjust it, but it suddenly just snapped at the wheel joint.  I was bummed because I had really found it helpful.  Maybe someone could make one with better plastic or metal, but I probably couldn't afford it then lol

Name: Glen Gustafson
Review Title: AMAZINGLY CLEVER STAND FOR ELECTRONIC DEVICES
Review Text: I was recently comparing several battery-operated shortwave receivers. I needed some kind of support stands, to be able to see the controls easily, and to manipulate the radios. I looked at a number of them, and by dumb luck, selected this one, made by Amazon. When they arrived, even the packaging was Apple-esque! The device is very cleverly designed. It folds beautifully, for transportation. Then when you open it up, it adjusts for a variety of different devices. It was probably not intended for shortwave radios, but because of it's superb design and manufacture, it adapts perfectly! I also use it for my iPad, and it would work well for your smartphone. The stand is very simple and looks fairly unbreakable.  Why  aren't more products thought out this well??

Name: J. P. Mcdonald
Review Text: This is one of the best gadgets that I have purchased in a long time.  I have a 10 inch Kindle Fire and it holds it in a great position while I am sitting at the table having breakfast or lunch.  I love it.  Before I had to hold it or lay it flat on the table.

Name: Chad
Review Text: LOVE this stand. It's cool when I find a low cost product that actually works well! This is one of those products. I use it as a permanent stand for an old iPad I use solely as a music streaming device for a vintage receiver. Very adjustable, sturdy and unobtrusive looking.

Name: Bondtrails
Review Text: This tablet stand is as simple as it gets, and more importantly, does the job as advertised. It will hold your tablet/touch PC in landscape or portrait mode securely and allows you to set the angle of your display in a wide array of positions. What's not to love?

Name: rich
Review Text: For the price, size, and application this is a terrific product. We use it for the phone, tablet, and even some books. Whoever designed this device thought of everything. I think the only thing that could improve this product is to provide a nylon case.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: Your life will be so much easier!!
Review Text: This tablet holder stand is wonderful!!  It can be adjusted to hold my Nook or my tablet in either upright or sideways configuration.  I have used it in my dining room, bedroom and kitchen - making recipes easy to see while following directions makes cooking so much more fun!  It does not take up much room and can be cleaned with just a damp cloth.  The tablet holder is very stable and can be adjusted in multiple ways.  Its versatility is just one of the benefits of this tablet holder.  I cannot recommend it enough!  Such a small price for making life so much easier!!

Name: Julia Kelly
Review Text: I use my tablet for novel writing and I was having an awful time finding a way to securely prop up my tablet. Cases just weren't cutting it. This is perfect. Light weight, foldable, and easy to set up. I am so happy I bought it!

Name: Max
Review Text: Liked the versatility of being able to use it for a tablet as well as a smartphone. For the money it is a great little product. The adjustments can be a little awkward at times and you have to be careful to not tilt it too forward.

Name: M. Martinez
Review Text: This stand... is amazing! Super sturdy holds my iPhone, my sons kindle, and my iPad 10.2â€

Name: Jesse
Review Title: We own 3 and will buy more
Review Text: I think we need these for ever room in the house.  Very versatile and makes a nice fidgit...Although donâ€™t tell my kids I said that.  I like that I can store it away if needed and it does not take up a lot of space.  Have plans to order more.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Text: Iâ€™ve had mine for 4 years and heck this thing still works awesome. Great price for a great product. Would recommend to a friend for sure. Recent bought another one so I can have a "backpack" stand and a "home" stand so I donâ€™t have to keep moving it around bc I use this thing every single day.

Name: Derrick H
Review Text: some time ago I purchased a second monitor (screen) for my Work/gaming station but what it came with just was not doing the trick and I needed something but everything out there was not cutting it so when I found this everything worked as it should I honestly thought it was going to be to small for my screen but man I freaking love it

Name: DaisyJo37
Review Text: My son is hard on his stuff, and so I didn't want to pay a ton for an expensive iPad stand for him. This one is GREAT, because it works very well, is collapsible for easy travel, and yet it holds up to his heavy use! High recommend!

Name: JC
Review Title: Great stand for Amazon Fire tablet
Review Text: I got this stand for connecting some MIDI devices so it would be hold in a proper angle to see the app running while playing a MIDI keyboard. Very happy with it and convenient as it folds in such a way that won't need much space.

Name: JimmyMac
Review Text: I love this will buy another for my wife. It makes the iPad usable turned portrait. Some Apps/games require you to turn the ipad to porttrait and most iPad covers only allow a locked position in landscape. Very sturdy on a table or even a lap tray. Adjusts to any angle. Good for any tablet.

Name: R. Siddiqui
Review Title: Best Value Stand that Every iPad Owner should have
Review Text: This small device made me fall in love with my iPad all over again. Who knew something so cheap, could be so useful, and essential to the optimal iPad experience.It's light, compact, folds down, and is easy to travel with. It doesn't just hold up your iPad, but it gives you the freedom to adjust to virtually any angle.No more propping up my iPad against random items around the house, hoping it will stay put. This is a great value item, and it will likely prove useful for every iteration of iPad.Most iPad stands are over priced, too large, too small, too flimsy, and/or have a limited range of motion, in terms of what angles you can adjust to. But this simple, yet effective device, is unobtrusive and scores high marks in all these categories (price, functionality, versatility, and efficiency). It's just right in virtually every way.I bought two stands (one for my 3rd generation iPad w/ Retina display, and one for my 3 year old son's 1st generation iPad) we both love them.

Name: Vince
Review Text: I needed a stand to keep my iPad in almost vertical position to facilitate videocalls. I'm very pleased with this tool, it's very flexible and it allows for many configurations and angles. Very stable as well and easy to fold and store.

Name: M. Griffin
Review Title: Stands up to usage on the go
Review Text: I frequently use an Ipad in direct locations at work. I didnâ€™t like the stands provided on site, as they had keyboards attached and couldnâ€™t angle. This adjustable tablet holder allows me to get better angles no matter what platform that Iâ€™m working off of. Itâ€™s also very durable, I just throw it in with my equipment at the beginning of my shift and go.

Name: Mary
Review Text: I ordered one for myself and liked it so much, I ordered another for my spouse. It's sturdy, it is easily adjustable, it works great for Zoom meetings (with my iPad) and when I'm done, click, click, and it is one clean, compact rectangle. Easy to stow in a backpack or purse. Highly recommend.

Name: Catherine
Review Text: I absolutely LOVE this!  It folds up so nicely and is easy to take along. My husband recently had back surgery and was told NOT to look down at his iPad, so he uses this instead on a table to keep his head held up.  His physical therapist told him of all the problems they anticipate with people constantly holding their head down to read iPads, iPhones, Kindles, etc.  It puts too much pressure on the neck and spine.I use this on planes.  Don't want to sit and hold my Kindle for hours and hours, (at home I prop my Kindle agains my Beanie Baby, but find it too bulky to take along). The plane tables are pretty funky, so I just put this on an let it do the work.  Recommend it highly.

Name: Lannie Haszard
Review Text: It does the job, but a piece of the padding on the upright piece came unglued  and now it sticks to the tablet whenever you pick it up.

Name: Kevin Murphy
Review Title: These are really really good for a Kindle or an iPad.  6 stars
Review Text: Bought one for my wife.  Then I bought one for me.  Then I bought another one for my wife for another room, and yet another one for a friend.These work well, are quality construction and take NO thought to set up.  Buy one.

Name: Advocate
Review Text: I use it all the time for my iPhone and iPad.  The first time you open the arms that form the bottom of the stand they can be a bit sticky.  Don't be concerned about giving a good tug to pull them apart.  Totally recommend.

Name: Lorna_01
Review Title: Fast  delivery and good size stand!!
Review Text: I just received my Amazon BasicPortable Fold Up Travel Stand for my new Kindled Fire HD today, and WOW the delivery was amazingly quick! I cannot believe how fast my items I ordered just about Hmm two weeks ago (?) And I got it today, I so love Amazon for there fast delivery . Okay let give you my opinion about the stand.  I am sitting on my bed with a laptop desk, and my KFHD is resting on the stand, and it is not slipping or moving around on the I first opened the box, I was quite pleased on how secured my item was packaged,but the stan seemed a little stiff and I was not sure if I use a little pressure it would break. But I am liking it very much! I would definitely recommend this item to anyone who has a iPad or a Kindle e-reader device like me (Kindle Fire HD)!

Name: Roadie
Review Text: I have used this with both Kinde Fire and iPad.  It works great.  I am able to follow online recipe instructions, play games, read my books while my hands are busy with something else, etc.  I highly recommend this product.

Name: Mike
Review Title: It's not flashy but it works
Review Text: Got this for my kindle when I read at a table and holds it up just fine. Very easy to get the right angle and keeps my hands free so I can drink and eat while I read or whatever else you might wanna do with your hands while you read.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: This is a pretty nice little stand
Review Text: This is a pretty nice little stand. It has padded areas so your tablet will fit comfortable and it has a sticky bottom so it does not slide. However it is not very versatile for different angles or set up. The arms move in stages not free move so it can only go certain ways. Other wise its pretty nice.

Name: Run4Fun
Review Text: This stand is quite flexible and would work well with most any tablet.  I am using it with a Fire HD8 enclosed in a MoKo case.  The stand would be fine with thicker cases and/or different sized tablets.  I do not adjust it much at all, but use it in both vertical and horizontal orientation without changing it.  For travel it folds up to a very compact size.  Well done.

Name: Wwe no holds barred
Review Text: One of the screws fell out after about 6 months.  I only used the stand a few times

Name: Greg O.
Review Title: Works with my iPad in a case.
Review Text: I got this as a stand for an iPad being used for remote learning. Wish it had more angles without the iPad falling forward but it works well enough for the price and the fact that itâ€™s pretty compact is a win in our book.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: A Ten Star Adjustable Tablet Stand by Amazon Basics
Review Text: This adjustable tablet stand holds my Kindle Fire both upright and horizontally.  Now.  All my uses are comfortable and manageable.  I also have an android phone, 3x6" size and it sits well on this adjustable stand.  The stand is easy to adjust.  I am so happy to have this for both devices.  I ordered a second one from another seller but very similar, and I'm looking forward to trying it out.  In addition, this adjustable stand will travel in my purse/bag/briefcase and I can take it out if I'm using my device at lunch and want to read, or watch video and have my hands free.  This is a 10 star device - because it has maximized the use of my devices: Kindle Fire and the Android Phone.  Very happy!

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Text: Works well for Kindle Oasis with case.  Large gripping rubber pads on all surfaces and very adjustable.  Easy to pick up entire thing without dumping the tablet out, since the back rest extends well up.  Also very unobtrusive with matte black finish.

Name: PK
Review Text: Was hoping to get a small stand I could travel with for tablets and similar. This stand is much bigger than I realized. overkill for what it needs to hold. I wish I read the dimensions. In my mind this was 1/4th the size. However it really could be that small and accomplish the same. Not sure why it's so large.

Name: Crystal Rector
Review Text: This is a simple product designed to do exactly what I needed, to stand so I can watch while cooking. Nothing special about the design but I didn't care about that.  I love the fact that it folds for easy storage. When folded,  it's about the shape of a small stapler.

Name: don from the islands
Review Text: I got this as a little christmas present for my wife. She uses it everyday!At night on a pillow to watch video on her Kindle Fire, on the counter when watching cooking vids on you tube. Folds up and fits right in her purse or pocket.Better than I thought

Name: SD
Review Title: Any tablet owner would like this
Review Text: This securely holds my iPad Air 2 at every angle I could want in portrait and landscape mode.  No more leaning, twisting, or propping. It compacts to very small portable size, about 8â€ x 1.5â€ x 1â€.  The apparatus doesnâ€™t interfere with any of the ports, buttons, or cameras. It works perfectly in every way!  I love products that work so I love this. This is the best ten bucks Iâ€™ve spent in a long time.

Name: Mgoro
Review Text: I really like it. Itâ€™s very simple and I feel confident in putting my ipad on it, without the fear that it will fall down. I was worried with the other holders that I saw that it could scratch the back of my iPad because they were metal with semi sharp edges. This one is not and with the curved wood there is no problem of that.

Name: Navy Guy
Review Title: New, but looks good so far
Review Text: Great for Fire 10" tablet, nice and stable.-1 star, enough clearance to charge devices with bottom mounted USB C or Micro USB connectors.Looks like the vertical joints can be tightened over  time with small phillips screwdriver.

Name: Ryan Caputo
Review Text: This stand is perfect for displaying my gold bar at work. I imagine that this ingenious piece will work for things you would never think of! I would 100% recommend this product to those who are looking for a way to prop something up to show off! The product arrived lighting fast, durable, and sturdy as my 92yr old gram mom.

Name: Gus
Review Title: Stable and sturdy. Does a pretty good job!
Review Text: Don't be fooled by the price. This item is actually a very good deal for the price. Sturdy and stable. Holds pretty well my 10.1 inch tabllet. You can also rotate the viewing angle from horizontal to vertical. Two thumbs up!

Name: Bryan Pearson
Review Title: This works great for portrait or landscape, but keep it dry - the base grips are foam.
Review Text: Works great.  The positions on the three joints are determined by small teeth and detente nubs that click past each tooth.  It works well, but I guess that would be the thing likely to wear out someday, if you open and close it a lot.  I liked that they put some foam grip on the top part against which the back of your device will rest.  I wish the foam grip on the base was rubber instead, in case of spills, or to keep it from rolling up when attempting to slide the stand rather than picking it up to move it.I like it very much.  It makes choosing an angle easier and is much steadier than simply propping my device against some other object.

Name: Todd Clan
Review Text: This is a wonderful little item. We bought three, one for each of us, and they all get used. My son uses his at the table and during his weekly trips to the clinic for infusions to set his phone on and watch videos; I use mine at my bedside to turn my phone into an alarm clock, and my wife uses hers to balance her tablet or phone while reading or browsing. It's adjustable so it easily accommodates devices of various sizes and it is light and small and easy to pack into a purse or messenger bag or even into your cargo pants pocket. It's sturdy and you don't have to worry about it collapsing, as it locks into place firmly until you adjust or close it. Highly recommended.

Name: R. A. Mungal
Review Text: I got tired of using large books to prop up the iPad...this is perfect for the table or a flat sturdy surface. It can be folded up (and dropped in a backpack for mobility I suppose) but this seems better staying indoors.

Name: char
Review Text: This is my second one of these it is so nice and you can adjust it to fit so many tablets and smartphones this is the best one that I found to work with everything and the shipping was fast you just can't beat Amazon.

Name: Sejal
Review Text: works really well with Lepow Monitor which I purchased for work from home, i struggled to balance it using the cover it came with.  Amazon Basics Adjustable Tablet Holder Stand worked wonders, my monitor is almost 16" twice the size of iPad.

Name: MAC
Review Text: I needed a way to display a glass framed photo and this stand worked perfectly! Easy to assemble, sturdy, and displays the picture at a perfect angle. I intend to purchase a second one for a second similar framed photo.

Name: EM
Review Title: It honestly feels sturdy, yet a bit cheap
Review Text: The price is unbeatable, and it does what it is supposed to. It honestly feels sturdy, yet a bit cheap. It has anti-sliding material at the bottom where it stands, as well as the surface where the tablet rests back and the indents where the tablet stands still. However, the anti-slide at the bottom could be better placed, since it makes it ever so slightly taller where that stuff is, but at the very back there's no rubbery thing, meaning once you put your tablet on the thing will wiggle a bit to the sides since the weight of your device will push the structure backwards where there's no rubber feet (see pics)... But your device won't fall, at least mine hasn't.

Name: Joe
Review Title: Great addition to my tablet accessories
Review Text: For the price this stand is great and very easy to travel with and store in your laptop bag.  It took me a while to find it, so wish that it was more prevalent when looking for something like this.  I only found it because a friend had one and told me she got it on Amazon.

Name: Grandma Lu
Review Text: I bought this for my 9 year old granddaughter as the school issued iPad had a broken stand. Easy to set up and requires very little space! It is perfect and reasonably priced. We use it daily as she is Distance Learning.  I highly recommend it!!

Name: Jonathan Jarvis
Review Title: The very same model as the Arkon stand
Review Text: I happened to order one each of the Amazon Basics and the Arkon. stands. Comparing them, they are exactly the same, including the same embossed model number made in Taiwan, except that the Amazon Basics stand has a nice Amazon logo printed on it and comes in a cardboard box, whereas the Arkon stand comes in a plastic envelope. The Amazon model is one dollar cheaper. Either stand does an excellent job of supporting a Nexus 7 tablet while I type on a Bluetooth keyboard. I still prefer a laptop for editing text, however, but the stand makes text entry feasible with a tablet when a laptop is not available.

Name: FireFerum
Review Text: This holder has multiple adjustment points, soft padding for the contact areas, and grips well on the bottom. We have used it on the table and on the bed and it works well to hold the tablet or cell phone. Just a simple, easy to use, easy to fold, easy to adjust item so it deserves 5 stars.

Name: Customer
Review Text: Well... like 5 months later this thing broke. Inexplicably. It was sturdy and definitely worked. But today a screw fell out for no reason. Now I have it held together with a twist tie. Ultimately a waste of money. Thanks amazonðŸ™„

Name: David Tsai
Review Text: This is a decent stand for the price. It is fairly stable, and has good feet. Unlike other stands, I like how this one lets me adjust the angle of my tablet.I usually keep it on my desk and use the movable arm as a wire management tool, since there is quite a bit of space between the tablet and the arm. I tucked cables into this space and wrapped the power cord for my tablet around the arm.However, this product still has a few flaws. The legs on this stand were incredibly tight, and opening made me feel like something was going to snap (fortunately, nothing did). This stiffness may have been acceptable if it were in another place on the product, which brings me to my next point. The supporting arm is a little loose for my liking. It holds up my Nexus 10 fine in landscape and portrait, but the arm has a very slight give to it when using the tablet while it is in the stand. This definitely isn't deal-breaking, but you should be aware of this. Finally, the pads underneath the tablet sometimes unstick themselves from the legs. So far, I've been able to press them back on to the legs and have them stay stuck for a while, but this is definitely an issue that AmazonBasics should investigate.

Name: JaneG
Review Title: Perfect For Propping up iPad or Tablet on Your Bed!
Review Text: I bought this stand so I could prop up my iPad in bed-ON my bed. Itâ€™s perfect. It doesnâ€™t even have to sit on a hard surface. Iâ€™m delighted!

Name: TexicanTop Contributor: Golf
Review Text: This a great stand. It has an articulating functionality which allows for many different positions and uses. The cutout in the legs are big enough to hold my iPad in a Defender by Otterbox nicely.  It folds up quickly and easily and stores nicely in my backpack by my iPad. The Defender case with stand holds my iPad in very limited positions including a typing position where the Amazon stand does not, so they actually compliment each other. The stand is a good quality. I have had it for a couple of months with pretty heavy usage. It has stood up well except for the cushion pads adhered in the leg cut outs. They are beginning to wear and peel off.  I can easily replace those with mounting tape but if I don't, it will not affect the performance of the stand.  If I were to lose this stand somehow, I would not hesitate to order this one again!

Name: LukeGobstopper
Review Title: Not the most attractive device stand, but one of the most functional
Review Text: Iâ€™ve used a number or stands for iPads/tablets, and most of them looked better than this one, but were also wobbly when used with my 12.9 inch tablet, which this one isnâ€™t. Functionally, I think this stand is one of the best, and it has a decent range of adjustability. The only thing I donâ€™t like about it is that itâ€™s pretty ugly. But it works great, so itâ€™s a compromise.

Name: Gail
Review Text: Love that I can achieve the perfect angle when reading or playing on a hard surface.  Only dissatisfied with the non-slip material on the feet as the glue doesnâ€™t stick well.  Folds up small and great for travel.

Name: Trish
Review Text: This is a solid built iPad holder.  I have the 9.7 iPad.  As you can see via the pictures so many positions available.  I purchased this to use while cooking.  Very balanced secure holder that I can push around as I cook.  Also like that is light and folds up small for travel.  Another great Amazon purchase.

Name: Nicole Brown
Review Text: Works the way it should and is has enough range of adjust-ability that I like it. I only recommend you don't worry about breaking it when you try to adjust it, because the one I received demands that you handle it roughly in order for it to want to move the way you need it to, anyway.

Name: George in Ct.
Review Text: I am surprised by this inexpensive little item. It really is one of those "why didn't I think of that" designs.  I use it late at night to hold my Fire HD 10 while I watch a video or movie in bed and it is completely stable. A great item!

Name: Mom of 3
Review Text: This is a well designed and versatile little stand. I use it for my Kindle and phone, and my hsuband uses his for his Kindle and also for actual books. It's stable and folds up into a small, easily packed piece.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Text: This stand is just perfect for holding my Kindle Fire.  I have a case that will hold it horizontally just fine but not vertically.  I like to read at the table while eating and this stand works great.  I like the way it folds up so compactly.  It is very adjustable for many viewing angles and for whatever tablet or reader you might have.  I love the rubber anti skid on the bottom so the stand doesn't slide when I am touching the screen on my Kindle.  It is very sturdy and doesn't tip easily.  Now I wish someone could find a way to incorporate something like this into a slim case!!  I am sure that ingenious person is already working on this so I will keep my eyes open. I bought the slim travel stand and it works well-if I take my Kindle out of it's case. That is too much of a pain.  THIS stand works with my case still on.

Name: Deborah
Review Text: I ABSOLUTLY LOVE IT!!!!This is great. Sturdy, well made, compact and easy to "take along", SAFELY holds Fire tablets and cell phone. I love all of the gripping non slip surfaces that secure the tablet as well as securely grip the counter or table it is setting on.  Wish I had known about and bought this sooner. And to top it off Excellent price. Thank you!!

Name: bl3h
Review Text: Works slightly better than expected. I use this with a Galaxy Note Pro 12.2 + case. Sitting quite vertical (so I can watch TV and videos), the stand is strong enough for my to peck at the keyboard and draw with the stylus. It's stable and doesn't slide on a wood desktop surface.Con: While in a vertical portrait position, the there is little more than the tip of the back support toughing the tablet. The rubber-ish foam-ish pad on the arm gets all the contact is peeling off. I have to be careful when placing and removing so that there is little movement.

Name: Jess D
Review Text: Fits my phone, my iPad, and my Kindle Paperwhite ereader (which is what I originally bought this for)Folds up neat and compact, would fit comfortably in a day bag or purse. Sleek design, easy to use, and looks great on my nightstand while also clearing up valuable space where my Kindle previously laid flat taking up said space. Excellent product.

Name: 49erJoe
Review Title: Amazon Basics knocked it out of the park again!
Review Text: I love this product. I use this at work to hold my Amazon tablet ( 7 inches ) or Samsung tab ( 10 inches ) and it gets the job done on both.This folds up so that you can easily fit in your desk, or bag to transport back and forth. It also can easily adjust so you can put your tablet straight upright, or sideways. It has little divets in the front so that your tablet kind of fits into the groove and is nice and sturdy while in the stand.If you have a big phone you could easily have this stand hold your phone as well, but I just use mine for the tablets.Thank you Amazon Basics for making another great affordable product.

Name: Susan Grace
Review Title: Great product at a great price
Review Text: Works easily with my phone and tablet.  The only issue I have is that if you want to plug in the power cord, you have to place the stand on a book or other higher surface so there's room to plug in your phone.

Name: Curtis M. Kularski
Review Text: I have purchased this particular stand several times. I have two of them personally. I use one on my desk as a place for my tablet to sit when charging and another I keep in my bag for when I'm out. These stands are light-weight, flexible and portable. They work well with most devices over 5" diagonal. I have used it for my Galaxy S5, but it isn't very stable for such a small device. My various tablets over time (ranging from 7" to 10.1") have all been well accommodated on these stands. This stand adjusts from sitting upright for movies to laying down at a gentle angle for typing.

Name: SoCal
Review Title: Love this well made versatile stand
Review Text: Just received this great little gadget. Love using it with my Kindle Paper white and Kindle Fire. Works beautifully on both even with their covers. Easy to change the angle and go from one gadget to another. I usually read at night in a recliner with my feet up and a pillow to make the Kindle just the right height. This stand doesn't need a solid surface and works great on my pillow.I just bought a pretty new cover with Van Gough, Les Iris. It is so pretty that I leave the Kindle with the cover displayed on the stand. Looks lovely and like a work of art.

Name: M. Davis
Review Text: This stand worked just fine except the bottom has a fabric that is designed to prevent the stand from sliding. That fabric is held on with some glue that doesn't work well. The fabric pieces come off if you shove the stand instead of picking it up.

Name: David W. Nesbitt
Review Title: Wife still uses it  but is slightly disappointed in it!
Review Text: My wife asked for this for Christmas so I willing bought this as she seldom requests anything. The price was pretty cheap.I thought this was fairly well built. And I've noticed she is still using it fairly frequently. Since she's being using it about 3 months with no problems I would say that validates it being well built. She has told me it needs to sit on a table or some other stable object. I guess she thought she would be able to hold it or use on a soft surface like our bed.She rated it 7.5 to 8.0 - she said it serves it's purpose but she was slightly disappointed in it.

Name: Brian Rodgers Jr.
Review Title: Great Stand, Very Versatile, No Complaints
Review Text: Awesome Tablet Stand at a great price! I bought this Amazon Basics product for my Samsung Galaxy Tab S and couldn't be happier. It's a very reliable stand, folds up nicely, doesn't take up much space in my bag. It is also very adjustable and works great in both horizontal and vertical positions. The foam padding is a welcome addition. It does a great job of preventing scratches on your tablet, and also provides a nice grip on the bottom of the stand, which avoids your tablet from sliding around.This AmazonBasics Adjustable Tablet Stand coupled with a wireless bluetooth mouse and an Anker bluetooth keyboard makes a great portable work station for professionals on the go.

Name: Travis
Review Text: Works very well for what it was designed to do. The adjustability is excellent. I can use if for my 7" tablet, my ten inch tablet, or even my phone. It's very sturdy and durable. Device can be placed at multiple viewing angles.

Name: papaya38
Review Title: Does It's Job, But Hard To Find Around The House
Review Text: Works well, but this skinny all-black gadget is hard to find among all the other skinny black gadgets and whatever you keep in drawers, under a pile of clothes, or on a dark wood table. First-world problem.

Name: Dennis
Review Text: Cheap plastic and a bit wobbly on the desk. Can't use iPad in portrait mode with charger plugged in. Not enough room underneath. I am sure there are much better stands on the market for a dollar or two more.

Name: Poncho
Review Text: I purchased this for my sister so she could through it in her bag to prop her iPad up at the coffee shop.  She was using a folding plate holder, so this works better than that, but is is pretty light weight.  I'll be curious how long it holds up.

Name: Red
Review Text: Itâ€™s incredible. Iâ€™m sorry it took so long to find this. The expensive crap I bought from Apple canâ€™t touch thisðŸ˜ Donâ€™t know if it will be suited for a soft surface, but itâ€™s great on a flat surface.

Name: Frank
Review Title: Works great with iPad with case
Review Text: Bought this for use in the kitchen. Use my iPad for recipes and it fits perfect even with my case that is a little thick. iPhone fits on it well. It is sturdy and well made and folds away for easy storage.

Name: Leslie L. Carter
Review Text: this is my second Amazon Basics Adjustable tablet stand.  The first one lasted 5 years with very hard use, so for the price this is the Best stand.  It is small, easy to use (for us old folks with 10 thumbs) sturdy and is perfect for my Kindle and folds up very small to fit in my purse.  If you are an avid reader or tablet user, this little stand is just great.  It travels wonderfully.  Mine has been to Alaska on a cruise and the Grand Canyon Tour.  It stays where you put it.  I recommend this stand to all.

Name: tina
Review Text: I ordered this stand by mistake I thought that I ordered a different one, when I took it out the box I was like ðŸ¤”ðŸ™„ðŸ˜® so many emotions and like wasnâ€™t one of them.  But after I realized how the stand worked i was like ok this is doable.

Name: Delfino Navarro
Review Text: Got this to use with my iPad Air 4, and I love it! There are some apps that I can only use in portrait mode and every case Iâ€™ve found only allows you to prop your iPad up in landscape mode, so this was perfect!

Name: LJ
Review Text: I think the design is more useful in more occasions than other more expensive ones. The price was reasonable but I have a serious concern about the quality. When I first opened the box and tried to open the bottom two legs, the gear that controls how wide the two legs should be is kind of low quality. I feel if I open and close the legs often, it will not last. It is not expensive but I don't think we should compromise on quality. Perhaps my piece is slightly defected but I don't wanna bother shipping it back and get a replacement. I will just deal with it.

Name: Larry L. Emsweller
Review Title: Do not have to remove my Ipad from case in order to use.
Review Text: I order this in order to read guitar music on my older IPad Gen 3, and it fits the bill perfectly (I sit it on my congra drum).  It is simple in function, but works flawlessly.  There are many adjustable positions, so I'm certain it will work for other devices.  As an added benefit, I do not have to remove my IPad from its case.  Ordering another one for my wife to use on the table beside the bed where she watches late night movies.  Great little invention.

Name: Armando
Review Text: I need the stand for my small tablet. But this stand is big and bulky. It can easily handle bigger sized tablets. The only real issue is that you got to be careful not to pinch your fingers. It collapses hard and if your not careful, your fingers can get caught.

Name: Timothy Sawer
Review Title: Problem solved .... no longer looking up family members' noses
