Review Text: Bought one of these for both my parents and my mother-in-law as I got tired of them trying to balance their phones as I spent most of the time looking at the ceiling or up their noses.We have found that this not only folds down to a small size when not in use but it works well with iPads, iPad mini's or iPhones.  We bought one for ourselves and quickly gave them as a gift to our respective parents (in part to maintain our visual sanity).  It allows us to adjust to the different physical characteristics of each device and also allows the stand to be adjusted in many ways so the camera on the device can be angled correctly for FaceTime purposes.  This is an ingenious stand as demonstrated by the 3 we have purchased and the many people we have recommended it to.

Name: Daniel Thies
Review Title: Easy to pack, unpack, and use. Does exactly what I wanted.
Review Text: I recently started working almost exclusively on my iPad, and needed a portable stand that didn't take up a bunch of space in my bag. I tried a couple others that were small enough but too flimsy. This stand is perfect. It works in portrait or landscape, doesn't get in the way of my keyboard, and fits the purpose in every way. Great value for the price.

Name: musicmommaSueTop Contributor: Coloring
Review Text: I just received my stand on Tuesday and have been using it since it was delivred to my home.It is very durable and stays in place.  The pads on the bottom keeps it in place.  The pad on the upper part keeps the device in place.This stand has so many possible positions that you can use it with just about any device.  It is easy to change the stand and it stays in place even while you are playing games on the Kindle Fire.  My son tried it with his Nexus 7 and it worked fine.It is easy to use and can be used right out of the box--no assembly needed.  The "arms" stay in place so they are not moving around but are easy to adjust even when your tablet is on it.It is very compact when folded up and easily fits in a purse or bag.  It feels very durable and should last very long.  The price was very nice also.

Name: Jon
Review Title: Best stand I have ever had with one issue
Review Text: The padding in the grooves where the tablet sits started coming off and would stick to the tablet so much that when you lift the tablet off it takes the stand with it briefly then drops the stand back to the table.  Aside from that it is awesome you can adjust it to just about any position you want your tablet to be in and it hold the tablet very well with no movement when typing or even when pressing the power button when the tablet is almost vertical in the stand.  Best stand I have ever had but took one star for the padding adhesive.

Name: Sue
Review Text: I bought a couple for my kids, to hold their iPads once distance learning became the norm.  I gotta say, I didn't expect them to last as long as they have, or to be as handy as they are.  I totally recommend them.

Name: J. Ryan
Review Text: My husband and I both use iPads at our kitchen counter, and each have this stand. It folds, and you can adjust its height, angle, and width. We even take one or both when we travel--sometime soon again!

Name: Judith A
Review Text: Why did I wait so long before ordering this item?  It is sturdy, very flexible and incredibly useful.  My arthritic hands make holding a book, tablet or kindle difficult but this holder stand solves the problem.

Name: Meagan Eggenberger
Review Text: These stupid little pieces of plastic are GREAT. I bought 2 and need 2 more. I use my iPad a lot and my kids use them a ton when we travel. I say they are stupid because it's such a simple concept but they are so worth it. The plastic is great quality and they are sturdy. My crew has tried and broken other iPad stands. They have yet to break these so I am happy.

Name: susan4tpierce
Review Title: This is the best tablet stand
Review Text: I have had this tablet stand for quite a while and it performs perfectly. It's a simple design. Because it adjusts in many ways I've used it for both my tablet and my cell phone. I keep my recipes available on my tablet and this stand keeps it upright and out of the mess.

Name: Paul
Review Text: It is said that the best designs are the simplest, and this is so true of this stand. Larger than I imagined, well made, sturdy and fits devices from phones to 12" tablets comfortably. The positions for the base and rear brace 'click' into place and stay where you put them. Easily folds for storage too.

Name: Anon
Review Title: So useful, especially during the pandemic
Review Text: This little stand is sturdy and extremely adjustable, holds my iPad and phone for zoom calls, and folds up small. I've been using it every day for months. No need for a more expensive stand - get this!

Name: Joanne S.
Review Text: Love it...I previously propped up my iPad on an open drawer...but this is better...lots of variability in the angles of support it offers...including one that I find perfect...good product...and a good price...

Name: MainelyClassics
Review Title: Works well and folds down to nothing
Review Text: Love this thing. Bought several more, so I can have one for each Kindle, and to hold my iPad at the right angle for making item videos, etc. etc. It is versatile, and seems sturdy enough for the price.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Text: I bought this item to replace the old foldable tablet cover I was using.  They kept falling apart.  This tablet stand is perfect. Itâ€™s stable, doesnâ€™t tip and I can use the tablet without worrying about it falling over.  I recommend it.

Name: Free Range Clickin'Top Contributor: Photography
Review Text: This cheap plastic gadget was well thought out. It does the job in keeping my big Kindle Fire HD propped up at the correct level.UPDATED on September 14, 2014: I've used this gadget for a year now and still like it. I recently sold my Kindle Fire HD, and in my search for its replacement I tried an iPad Mini, an Acer 8" tablet, and finally, a Nexus 7 FHD (2013 model) tablet. The Nexus 7 was the keeper. I used this stand with each of the contenders, both in portrait and landscape mode. Because the stand is so adjustable, it securely held all three of those tablets.Dollar for dollar, it's one of the best technology buys I've ever made.

Name: Aidan Horn
Review Text: This looks neat, so you can feel more smart using it around other people. The disadvantage is when you want to charge your tablet at the same time as reading from it when placed vertically, because the charging cable doesn't fit underneath the tablet. To solve that problem, I have always turned the tablet upside-down, and most apps rotate 180 degrees when you do that.

Name: JenniferK.
Review Text: Itâ€™s an excellent little stand for my daughters school iPad. I didnâ€™t want to invest in a full case since it already had one but we needed something to help it stand up for her video calls. This does the job.

Name: xavg
Review Text: Good product, can hold a large tablet and small cellphone., One thing make sure you dont push back on the tablet when its mounted, the arm in the back is not meant to have that amount of force exerted

Name: Matt
Review Title: Very portable, adjustable, easy to setup
Review Text: Easy to setup for tablets large and small. Can even work for a phone if you manipulate it enough. Love how this fully collapses for travel. Might prefer something out of metal for durability's sake, but for $9 this solves one of life's most nagging problems - how to watch your favorite device without holding it!

Name: Joe B
Review Text: Ok so I have an iPad Air but it is encased in a 'Survivor' series hard case. Finding a stand that can support the size &  weight of the case is challenging. What's even more challenging is that it does that while standing upright 'portrait'. With the case I have most of the time it will either not fit or slip out of the other stands I have so I have to pull it from the case..This stand does it and does it well. It doesn't move or shift if you use it on the stand. My case size is not a problem with this stand.. I like how I'm able to adjust the stand and I like how it folds up neatly. Basically for the price I challenge you to find anything better.

Name: Stephanie Christopher
Review Text: This is perfect for a table or to use in the kitchen for recipes.  It works vertically or horizontally equally well.

Name: avidreader
Review Title: Lightweight, stable, easy to use stand
Review Text: This works perfectly with my iPad, which I use all the time for business, communications, Internet, and zoom. The stand is easy to set up, sturdy, and with infinite angling possibilities. Can be used with iPad, iPhone, or other tablets.

Name: FW
Review Title: Great stand I will take on trips.
Review Text: Just received it.  It is light.  Joints are reassuringly tight.  My tablet can sit sturdily on the stand.  It may not be as strong as some of the aluminium stands, it is a stand I can travel with. Well done, Amazon.  Another practical Amazon Basics product!The only concern that I have is about the rubber glue on pads at various contact points- they seem they could come off easily...I will see.

Name: SomethingAwesome
Review Text: I don't like those little flappy/fold-y cases everyone has. I love how this one makes possible a whole range of viewing angles and using my iPad vertically or horizontally. I also LOVE how this folds up - it's so small and unobtrusive that it's perfect for traveling (and guest rooms that don't have tvs!). It's also low-profile enough that I can use it as a stand when I want to display my iPad like a digital picture frame.I did subtract one star because it gets sticky sometimes and gives me a hard time getting all the angles I want.

Name: Garry V. Mallett
Review Text: Love this little item...I mostly take it to Disneyland while waiting to see fireworks or parades sometimes. It's nice to not have to hold a full sized iPad when trying to pass the time for shows at the parks...it's also great for streaming YouTube tutorials and you need your hands free...great little gadget...

Name: Chet
Review Title: Very light weight and adjusts well for landscape or portrait orientation
Review Text: I purchased this for traveling. It's light-weight and changes to a lot of positions - overall very nice. The only slight negative is that the foam feed stick a bit to the table.

Name: Matt
Review Text: This is a clunky nightmare. It fits small tabs but doesn't stand up reliably for any larger ones. Tap screen on a 10" and it just falls right on over and spills your coffee all over your tab. Yay!

Name: aj
Review Title: Works well with any size device
Review Text: I like this very much. I've used it with a tablet, a phone, a cookbook, and a magazine. It is very adjustable to whatever size device you're using. It has been handy even to use for Zoom meetings.

Name: Michael M. Murray
Review Title: This the the perfect accessory for an iPad
Review Text: This portable stand fits my iPad and iPhone perfectly since it adjusts so easily.  We have had one of these before and someone either misplaced it or it was lost.  Maybe I should by one of those trackers for this one.

Name: Arcadia
Review Text: Perfect adjunct for us readers who much prefer reading in portrait mode.  This handy little gem, holds my 10.1 tablet with no problem in either portrait for my reading or landscape for viewing videos.  Folds down to such a compact size that is easily transportable and adjusts to different sizes and angles for just about any tablet you could have.  It is very stable and all I can say is:  Well done Amazon!

Name: Michelle
Review Text: I have a Samsung Galaxy A7 Tablet (approx 7 X 10 size).  The holder is sturdy and includes slight cushion (on bottom of legs, back support, and where the tablet is held by the legs)  to prevent skidding/movement when you touch the screen. The part the supports the back can be adjusted for different positions.  It folds up and stores easily.  Satisfied with the purchase.

Name: Shana P.
Review Text: I was skeptical about this product because of it's affordability and engineering.  I have a 10 inch Amazon Fire, which I've found to be too big for most products that advertise for up to 10 inches.  The product arrived fast,  appropriately packaged, with easy instructions.  I did watch a youtube video before purchasing, in order to have some working knowledge of the product.  It functions as advertised and has exceeded my expectations. So far,  my 10 inch tablet,  my daughter's 7 inch tablet and my Galaxy 7 edge all can be used, securely with this product.  It's definitely worth the price, easy to use and  to transport.

Name: John Henrikson
Review Title: I loved it, but lost it
Review Text: I had this style of stand from another manufacturer.  I loved it, but lost it.  I found this on AmazonBasics and immediately bought it.  Unfortunately, I must have had one from a bad batch, as it snapped in two almost immediately out of the box.  And, not at a pivot point.  I broke right in the middle of one of the arms.  Nothing heavy was being applied.  I was just opening it to use it.  It didn't occur immediately out of the box as I got a day or two use out of it.Given the great price, I would probably try it again to see if I got a better one, because I really do like the design.

Name: J. Becker
Review Title: A gadget thatâ€™s worth the price
Review Text: Itâ€™s compact and doesnâ€™t take much room . My iPad and my kindle both fit on it nicely. They sit at a comfortable angle which makes to easy to seen and read the screen. . Itâ€™s well worth the price

Name: GeezerCaveman
Review Title: Works for a lot of devices
Review Text: You're pretty much stuck to a limited number of reading angles, but within those limits it's a very stable platform. I can use it on my Kindle Paperwhite and my 10" Android tablet equally well.

Name: Foureyes
Review Text: I love that this little jewel does what it claims to do. It works on my Kindle Touch, Kindle Fire 7 and Kindle Fire 10. I am so pleased to have spent the ten bucks for such a handy little tool.

Name: j-Riv
Review Text: I bought this to use as a stand for a 16" portable usb-c monitor. The stand that came with the monitor is magnetic and with a little movement would cause the monitor to flop over. This stand works, could be a bit bigger for my case, but it was obviously not intended to be used the way I use it. Great stand for the money.

Name: Melinda Madden
Review Text: The media could not be loaded.                  Â I got this on a whim for my boys tablets since they are doing online schooling due to covid... and I LOVE THEM! They were super affordable and got to me within 3 days. They have no assembly. You literally just unfold it after you unbox it. It has non slip grip at the bottom so it doesnâ€™t slide on the table and non slip grip where it leans against the tablet. Itâ€™s lightweight and it helps so much with keeping the camera pointed at my boys so they can talk to their teachers. Highly recommended!

Name: LeOB
Review Text: I love this stand. Itâ€™s small, lightweight and holds the ipad in many positions including vertical for FaceTiming. If you donâ€™t spread the feet open wide it also accommodates an iPhone. Super easy to use or store if not in use, great price.

Name: N. Fry
Review Text: I love the stand! It folds up tiny and neat when not needed. When it's needed it has every adjustment you could want. I use it for everything from my cell phone to my Kindle Fire HD 8, both upright or horizontal.

Name: Just My 2 Cents
Review Text: I use these to hold my ASUS ZenScreen MB16ACE 15.6â€ Portable USB Type-C Monitors. They are stable and they raise the monitors just high enough off the desk to be able to run the cables underneath the monitor to the computer.

Name: L. Mastrigt
Review Text: Best stand ever! It doesnâ€™t slip it doesnâ€™t slide it doesnâ€™t collapse! It holds a heavy iPad while my small children bump and move and dance around it ðŸ¤£. Ordered one more we love it so much !

Name: Pastor Jean
Review Text: This stand does have quite a bit of adjustibility but once I used it---it's not my go to stand but it should work fine if this is the type of stand that you need for what you are using it for.

Name: Nate Osborn
Review Title: A stand up device.  Holds up its own.
Review Text: This thing is awesome.  I unfolded it and put my iPad on it and it just stayed there.  I travel with it daily in the airline industry and use it everyday in the training rooms.  Has help up to two years or so everyday use and show very little wear.  I great sturdy device for everyday use.

Name: Andrew and Jenny B.
Review Title: Great stand at an excellent price
Review Text: I bought this stand for my Kindle Fire HD.  I really like it because it's so adjustable and because it's very stable.  I use it for both horizontal and vertical (landscape) positions with excellent results.  It's little feet are as non-slip as the come.My wife got one too (she was jealous) for her Kindle Fire first generation.Although there have been some complaints about charging a first gen Kindle Fire with this stand when it's in vertical position, an easy "work around" is to set it on the stand in horizontal (landscape) position then plug it in the side.My wife and I both use our stands every day and neither of us would willingly give them up.BTW: It's a little stiff when adjusted the first few times but that goes away with use.Andrew in MN

Name: Chris
Review Text: Within two days the rubber bottoms to keep it from sliding around were coming off of the bottom. I found the pads in the bottom of my backpack and figured out where they came from. Disappointed in the quality.

Name: Marshall
Review Text: The Fire 7 Kids Edition does not come with a stand and most stands seem to be designed for a full size iPad or Android tablet without a case.  This works absolutely perfectly for the little tablet with the bulky foam case and I cannot recommend it enough.

Name: jojo
Review Text: I use this stand for my iPad Pro and it works beautifully.  It is adjustable to allow the iPad to be at different angles.  It doesn't take up much room and all in all I am very happy with it.

Name: JES
Review Title: Highly adjustable, sturdy, and extremely well designed
Review Text: I bought 2 radically different brands, with 2 radically different designs. The other is in the garbage. This one, never! I went away on business and needed to take a light-weight portable monitor (shaped like a super wide iPad) so I could have 2 displays for my laptop. The first stand couldn't support the monitor in any way. On the other hand, this Amazon stand is highly adjustable, sturdy, and extremely well designed -- and therefore earns a top score. Well done!

Name: Richard A. Walsh
Review Text: I bought this for my Fire HD 8, which is a little too large for me to hold in my hands for more than 10 minutes or so.This does the trick. Adjustable to any viewing angle. Frees up my hands.The non-skid rubber appliques on the bottom tend to come off easily.But for that, 5 stars.

Name: Angie C.
Review Text: This stand was purchased for my 2 year old son so that he doesnâ€™t have to hold his fire tablet. It is indestructible! I love that it can hold multiple size tablets (iPad, fire tablet, iPhone) and can be used to display horizontal and vertical.It also doubles as a fun toy for him to play with as it open and closes. Hours of entertainment!

Name: Bruce
Review Text: Great little stand for the price.  Simple to adjust for either vertical or horizontal views.  Light enough that you can travel with it.  Nice to have for long flights and airplane fold down trays.

Name: msthamara
Review Title: Found another great location to use this stand
Review Text: Main concern was finding a stand that can hold my tablet while in its case. It fits fine with or with out the case. It also makes for a great holder to hold my book while in bed reading :-)

Name: Wayne B
Review Text: This is a basic tablet or phone holder but it does the job of holding my tablet in the position I want it in with no problem. Stable and adjustible, and cheap, just the combination I like.

Name: Max Federle
Review Text: This is a great little accessory! Lightweight, compact and sturdy when in use. I honestly didn't expect much for the price but it is a savy little stand that will ride in my everyday bag with my tablet and bluetooth keyboard. I absolutely recommend this for anyone needing a tablet or phone stand.

Name: Beata
Review Title: Works well with thick â€œKidâ€ case
Review Text: I bought two, had to return one because it wasnâ€™t balanced. So one star off for hassle.The most important thing for me was that this holds an 8â€ kindle in a foam kid proof case. Itâ€™s a good design and will nicely hold your table without falling over.

Name: Fernando Ibarra
Review Text: The price alone makes this something worth trying.  It does everything the expensive stands do without being too flashy.  If you are looking for something flashy, then this isnt the product you need.  It just does the job.

Name: Shane Rogers
Review Text: A tough, highly adjustable stand that can fit a variety of devices. I've used it with everything from a full-sized iPad to a Fire Tablet to an iPhone X, but the size and heft of this stand makes it ideal for larger items (there are better options for smaller devices). Despite the bulk of this stand, it does fold cleverly into a (relatively) slim form-factor for ease of portability. Overall a well-designed, fairly-priced, exceptional solution for medium-to-large tablets.

Name: Bocaboy
Review Title: Great iPad stand for either a Mini, Air or Android-based tablet
Review Text: My wife lost her original Shaark iPad stand on a recent trip, and we purchased this as a replacement. It has all of the same great features for use as an iPad stand and folds up to a size that is easily carried in your suitcase, backpack or handbag. It adjusts to almost any angle and holds the tablet securely. I've had more people ask me about this device, and I always tell them to go to Amazon and buy one. For the money, it simply can't be matched by any other stand for utility or its ability to fold up and be a great traveling companion.Highly recommended!

Name: MikeD
Review Title: Works great on a solid surface
Review Text: I like it is so stable compared to using the case as a stand. When I was using the case as a stand I had to hold the tablet so it would not fall over. I also like that it is large enough to hold a tablet.

Name: Valerie
Review Text: This is my second one because I use the first one at home and bought this one to travel with. Itâ€™s very compact to carry yet very sturdy. Iâ€™m really liking this product. Price is great also.

Name: Don H.
Review Title: Work well with larger size tablets!
Review Text: I ordered two for Christmas gifts for extended family members. They liked the stands my wife and I were using for our Samsung 10 and 12 inch tablets. The plastic stands are very sturdy and flexible.  I bought our pair from another vendor about 2 years ago and they were now out of stock. I discovered the identical stands at Amazon and bought them, the only difference was the pair from Amazon has their logo on them. They are ideal for the larger size tablets.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Text: Bought this for my husband whoâ€™s always propping his iPad up on something. This works perfect! You can adjust it so it can be in any position whether vertical or horizontal. And storing is easy since it folds up. Highly recommend!

Name: Mom in San Jose, CA
Review Text: I love this little gadget! I looked at alternatives and am so glad I chose this stand.  It is very sturdy.  More than that, it easily adjusts for my smart phone or tablet.  As other reviewers stated, it does easily hold my Kindle WITH the cover on.  The tablet is a bit less sturdy on it, but it works.  No problem at all with my phone on it; charging or not.  I'm planning to buy more as presents!

Name: Tammy
Review Text: After reading the many negative reviews on this product, I almost didn't purchase it. But at only $10, I thought if it's really a piece of junk I'll just return it - no harm, no foul. My verdict? It is really a good stand for my Samsung tablet! It's very sturdy and keeps the tablet stable! I'm happy to not have to hold my tablet every time I want to read something! It isn't fancy or elaborate, but it does the job - and that's what matters to me! A great stand at a great value! I highly recommend it!

Name: Kathy T.
Review Title: Fits the nexus 7 (2013) model nicely. Differently viewing angles. Folds up nice and small. Just buy this already.
Review Text: I bought this as a stand for my nexus 7. With the proper adjustments it fits it perfectly vertically and horizontally. You can also tip it forwards or backwards for different viewing angles. It does grab the tablet firmly so it shouldn't slide around unless you have it on your belly and are moving it around perhaps, it also has grippers on the bottom so it won't be sliding around on the desk. When you are done it folds up nice and tiny for storage. Only thing it is missing is a nice little case so it doesn't get scratches.

Name: Rhea Michele
Review Title: Sturdy enough to trust on a high counter without fear ...
Review Text: I use this mostly for my tablet in the kitchen when I'm cooking a new recipe. I turn the tablet screen on for the longest time and prop it up so I can look at it while I prep and cook. Saves me from wasting paper on printing a recipe I'll only use once.Sturdy enough to trust on a high counter without fear of it dumping the tablet off.

Name: Scrim
Review Title: Works better than I thought it would
Review Text: I bought this for an Amazon 7" Fire tablet.  Works very well, looks good.  I can leave the tablet in the stand and use it to operate the apps, holds the tablet securely.  Great value!

Name: Cad Yellow
Review Title: so it's a good balance between lightness plus small portability and stability
Review Text: I use this stand frequently outdoors on a picnic table, and seldom does a wind come up strongly enough to knock it over, so it's a good balance between lightness plus small portability and stability.  I like it enough that I've bought others as gifts.

Name: Marie
Review Text: I bought this tablet stand for my mother and ended up buying one for myself as well. I love how portable and simple this stand is! I can't forget to mention the fact that this IS NOT one of those cheaply made contraptions that slowly close up on itself over time causing you to constantly fumble with it and your tablet! Once you have this stand open to the desired position, it stays put and ACTUALLY does its job. What a concept! Definitely recommended!!

Name: grt0106
Review Title: A Table Stand Worth Waiting For
Review Text: The problem with most stands is that they are meant primarily for landscape view, which is primarily for watching movies.But what about those of us who use our Kindles mostly to read books?This is an exceedingly well-designed and -made device. I especially like the rubberized feet, which safely maintain the position of the device on one's desk.Did I mention that it is exceedingly portable when folded?I waited a long time for a wonderful tablet stand like this to appear, and it was well worth the wait.

Name: Josh F
Review Text: I was not sure what to expect when I bought this tablet stand but it is fantastic. It positions my table and even phone to where I can easily view the screen. The stand folds up small and is easy to pack. Very happy with my purchase.

Name: Cadence
Review Text: My daughter uses this for her Amazon Tablet and also to prop up her cell phone as well...simple design but effective...seems pretty durable so far, but she's only had it one day : )

Name: Bonnie Harvey
Review Title: Best little gadget i ever purchased.
Review Text: Needed a stand for my kindle and didn't want to spend a fortune for it.This little stand is just what i needed.It folds up for traveling but unfolds in seconds. It"s worth trying.

Name: katscot
Review Title: Highly recommend and would buy again.
Review Text: I really like this little stand for my iPad. I keep it on my desk and it can easily be moved to the kitchen so I can see a recipe on my iPad. Highly recommend and would buy again.

Name: Jaime M. Martinez
Review Text: Originally I was looking for a case/stand combo but already had a sleeve for my 1st gen Kindle Fire so when I came across this product I was excited because it was exactly what I needed. I have used this stand on two flights so far and only in landscape mode for watching movies but so far I love it.  It is very sturdy in landscape mode and it will fit many sized tablets.  The soft pads on the bottom and where the tablet contacts the stand helps to prevent any type of sliding.  This was put to the test on quite a bumpy flight and the stand/Kindle stayed in it's place without any problems.Pros:- Sturdy construction- Very stable- Fits many sized tablets- Works in portrait and landscape modeCons:- Slightly bulkier than i had hoped when folded up, but worth it since it is so sturdy and can fit small and large tabletsOverall, I would definitely recommend this for anyone who has a Kindle, Android Tablet, or iPad and plans to travel with it or wants to be able to use it at a table without having to hold the device at all times.

Name: Scott William FoleyTop Contributor: Star Wars
Review Title: Stays Upright In Our Van For the Kids To Watch Shows
Review Text: Though a simple contraption, this item proved exactly what we needed.  We download Prime kids shows to our Kindle Fire when traveling.  In the past, we'd place the Kindle upright on our console and prop it with a tissue box or purse.  Any abrupt stops or sharp turns would send it teetering.  When I happened across this item, its size, design, and rubber feet seemed to fit our needs.  I'm happy to say it did.  We recently traveled five hours in the van, and though the kids didn't watch shows on it the entire time, it did remain upright and in position without fail.  I couldn't be more pleased with it.

Name: Thomas T.
Review Text: Exact clone of an Arkon Stand.  Don't know how they get away with copying it.  Not quite as smooth as an Arkon though.  Stiffer and harder to click the parts into position.  I noticed Arkon lowered thier price to beat the amazonbasics price.  Given a choice, stick with the Arkon.

Name: Cathy W.
Review Title: Versatile. It does what it says it will.
Review Text: I now read the newspaper on my tablet. This little device makes it a lot easier on my neck and back! Surprising adjustable; works for my 7" tablet as well as for a10" one. Would even work for a smart phone as well as a larger tablet. Seems well made.

Name: Rockyjones
Review Title: What you gain is a sturdy stand with good rubberized(or whatever) feet
Review Text: This stand is outstanding, not as small or convenient in terms of portability compared to the Hoohii, but still portable enough to take anywhere with your device(for me generally a tablet).What you gain is a sturdy stand with good rubberized(or whatever) feet, that, and the slightly heavier frame, make this stand great for apps where you are actively working, such as office, or any of your usual needs to move in, or out of apps, not to mention apps (video, music etc.), that are not required to be constanly utilized, such as playlists, whatever. Love it!!

Name: jamie higgins
Review Text: I purchased these stands for my grandsons tablets. Actually saw them in action. Very pleased with these stands; they are sturdy and compact. They foldaway and store without taking up much space, when not in use. I guess the initial set up of the stands was challenging, but my daughter-in-law got it figured out.

Name: Jimbo
Review Text: I use this for a Samsung Galaxy Tab4 7-Inch. I tried using some bookcase style covers for my tab, but I found that when folded into a stand, the tab would fall right over at the slightest touch, or even when not touching it at all. This little stand from Amazon is perfect! It doesn't slide around at all, stays in place when I touch the screen, and it even holds the tablet with a Poetic Hard Case on it.Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 7.0 Case - Poetic Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 7.0 Case [Revolution Series] - [Heavy Duty] [Dual Layer] [Screen Shield] Protective Hybrid Case with Built-In Screen Protector for Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 7.0 White/Gray (3 Year Manufacturer Warra...It folds up very small, perfect for travelling or taking to school.

Name: Deandczr
Review Title: solidly built. steady. all round nice piece especially for price, compared to other fancier units.
Review Text: solid, easy to open and fold, easy to pack for all travel. Adjustable. Low tech but part of its beauty. Accommodates multiple pads and sizes. rubber footed for added stability. Worth it. I returned a couple High tech models because they were overkill.

Name: Scooterboy
Review Title: Holds any tablet or cellphone vertically or horizontally, and very well.
Review Text: I really like this stand. it holds any of my tablets and cellphone vertically or horizontally at just the right angle. Makes life a little more convenient, and costs less than other stands I've seen online.  I've been very happy with it, and recommend it.

Name: M K Temple
Review Title: Only one drawback to this model
Review Text: The only problem I found with this Kindle holder is that it's more stable in landscape than in portrait position.  It  seems sturdy (and I've used it frequently) and snaps down to a compact size for travel.  Excellent value!

Name: Renae M
Review Title: Best thing  bought. For my devices!!
Review Text: This stand is simply awesome!  I use it with my. Phone or iPad!  Is very sturdy. It holds my devices in place to be hands free. Great for zoom meetings or video calls.it doesnâ€™t slips out of place.many different angles for all your neeeds!

Name: James Brady
Review Title: It's a stand and it generally works for the most part
Review Text: This piece of plastic is very, very, very basic. You can hold your Kindle Fire HD 7, which is what I used it for, in landscape or in portrait. But when standing straight up, it's very unstable and can be pushed over if you planned on doing anything other than just using it to watch videos.That said, it accomplishes what it set out to do and at the end of the day, that's what I care about.My fiancee' sets it up on her vanity and watches makeup instructional videos while doing her makeup. It serves that purpose well.Pros: It works, usuallyCons: Cheaply made, confusing at first, not especially stable

Name: Susan C. Miller
Review Text: Takes some practice to get my fire tablet exactly positioned. The stand itself does not sit perfectly level in every move, but itâ€™s better than propping up against canisters in the kitchen. Works great for phone in portrait view.

Name: First
Review Text: Saw on a morning show for " great under 9.00 gadgets "and had to get it an it's a great gift too ...I use to watch prime videos on my kindel ...no more leaning against pillows

Name: Marcus
Review Text: I recently purchased a 15.6 inch portable monitor that came with a stand, but it tipped over a few times so needed something a little more stable. I purchased this stand and it was just what the doctor ordered!! Very small, sturdy and can adjust to different viewing levels. Great value.

Name: MyOkie
Review Text: Bought this stand to hold my 1st graders iPad for at home learning this start of the school year. It is probably the BEST seven bucks I have spent on a school supply.  Two thumbs up!!!

Name: Jon-Paul LeClair
Review Title: Great portable stand for your tablet
Review Text: I wanted an easy way to prop up my tablet when I'm running sound and this seems to fit the bill nicely.I have a 9.6in Samsung Tab E in a rugged rubberized case. I was concerned about the stand's ability to accommodate my configuration, but I'm very happy to report that it holds the device perfectly and securely.Plenty of adjustable positions. Very sturdy and no slippage for the tablet or the stand. Plus it folds up compactly and easily fits in my backpack.Recommended.

Name: Mikah
Review Title: Way more versatile than you might think
Review Text: You can use this with all sorts of different devices of different sizes and get great results with angles and consistent support.The stand articulates in all the right places making adjustments for different devices a breeze.  Super great value, so much so that I wound up buying a couple more.

Name: dc
Review Title: Great for iPad, iPad Pro, or iPad mini + packs small for travel
Review Text: Bought two cuz these are so good. I like to bring one with me on business trips to use on the plane or in the hotel room. It has grippy pads to hold your device in place and folds neatly into a small stick that's easy to pack away in a bag. Nice work Amazon (if you really designed it).

Name: Electro
Review Title: Must Have for Your Kindle Fire Tablet!
Review Text: If you're upset with the stand features of your tablet cover, this is the item for you. It adjusts easily in multiple positions for both horizontal and vertical viewing. It folds compactly for easy storage and is especially handy when traveling. I've used this adjustable stand for every Fire Tablet I've ever owned and wouldn't be without it.

Name: Teresa Kofoed
Review Text: during slow times while at work I read (escalation dispatch), this saves space on my work desk and it saves my neck from becoming to stiff.  I have seen other stands but I am happy that I decided to purchase.

Name: Erica
Review Text: Stand was good until one of the screws came off and a small part was lost making it impossible to reattach one of the legs. Otherwise, light and portable to hold tablet and phones to entertain daughter but didn't last more than 6 months.

Name: Bob
Review Text: I was in a hurry so needed to order something to hold up my tablet/portable monitor.  It works okay but for $11, feels a little like I got ripped off.  Made of flimsy plastic

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Text: I love this tablet holder. Itâ€™s very sturdy, even when using it in bed. I was very surprised and pleased that I can even put my iPhone 8+ on it and it holds it sturdy as well!  Great product!!!!!

Name: Elizabeth S
Review Title: Versatile and easy to use, transport
Review Text: This stand fits my 2 different sized kindles and iPhone 11. Stand easily adjusts and takes up no space. Can toss in my purse and go. I like I very much.  Would buy again

Name: Hannan
Review Text: this is the perfect fit for me. i don't have to have some cumbersome button on the back of me phone. i just place my phone on the stand at the angle i choose and enjoy.

Name: Anthony Glavocich
Review Text: I really like this stand. It's strong, versitle, I believe durable, and folds into a small package taking up very little space. I have used it to hold my iphone, an 8 inch tablet and a 12 inch very heavy tablet. Great for traveling. I recently flew across the country. I took this stand, my 8" tablet loaded with a few movies, and a pair of noise cancelling bluetooth earphones. I watched movies hands free the entire trip and all the gear took up almost no space in my carry on.

Name: D. Dahlbeck
Review Text: I don't know what else you could possibly want a tablet stand to do or why you would ever pay more than this for one. It's adjustable it's sturdy it does everything it's supposed to do

Name: Barbara Mackie
Review Text: I have gone through many purchases to locate the right stand for my tablet that will support horizontal and vertical positions. This simple little device became that solution. I do like my tablet to be dust protected though. The screen is dust and fingerprint protected. No problem. It can be dealt with. My only complaint was that the packaging for such a small item was WAY too big! Maybe you can come up with a smaller box for this size item. Something to think about. Otherwise, pleased with my purchase.

Name: Jim Petersen
Review Title: Exactly what I wanted for my tablet
Review Text: My tablet case only holds the tablet in a landscape viewing angle.  I needed a device to hold it in the portrait position.  The Amazon Basics Stand was a PERFECT solution!  It is very COMPACT when folded up - easy to stow and carry with you.  Its design is a work of GENIUS - adjusts to fit my tablet and align the viewing angle the way I need it to.  I HIGHLY recommend this product.

Name: Majed
Review Text: It is very cheap but, this doesn't mean it is bad quality. I have seen it as so many you tubers using it their iPad, tablets,...etc.Go head for it. You won't regret as an excellent stand for your tablet.

Name: Kat B
Review Title: Simply designed means a good working item
Review Text: We love it.  I purchased 2. One for me & one for my husband. It's great. Folds up and fits in my purse for long car trips and unfolded it fits both my kindle 4 & my iPad in their cases. No hassle. I just wish it had a sleeve for storage. I worry that I'm gonna ruin it. But then I stop and think... I only spent $10 on this. I can alway get a new one if needed. I did notice that it is a little hard to unfold it, but that is actually ok as it means that it won't close on me by itself. A suggestion would be to make them in different colors for those that like their accessories to match. It is actually one of those few items that is perfect as it is.

Name: RockingTheCarhartts
Review Text: All in all it does I bought it for. It adjusts to almost an upright position which is great when Iâ€™m laying down watching movies. The feet are adjustable and beveled edge on feet holds my kindle snugly. May not be optimal for equipment that has bulky protectors but my kindle does have a rubbery protector on it. I might buy one for my parents.

Name: sammy
Review Text: So compact and adjustable for my phone or Kindle.  I use mine mostly for my Kindle to sit it on my kitchen counter to follow recipes or in bed where I can lay on my side and read.  It sits on the bed perfectly leaving in front of me with just having to use my finger to turn the page or stream shows.  This is a good gift to give anyone!

Name: ld
Review Text: Hahaha the joke was on me. I thought after I saw how it was packaged it would be flimsy. I put my brand new Samsung tablet on it and because it is adjustable it fits perfectly. I will also be able to use my larger tablets as well. I bought it for kitchen use so now I can see the recipe.

Name: Allison
Review Text: Very simple product and works great with my iPad Air 2 in its LifeProof case. Easily adjustable and works really well. Can fold it back up to travel with it. Highly recommend!

Name: GHanson
Review Text: I use to hold my Kindle Fire tablet.  The stand is very stable and holds my tablet so I can use it hands free or not, my choice.  It is adjustable for any situation.  It fits in my tablet case so I can take it with me wherever I go.  I love it.

Name: justmuse
Review Text: I love this stand.  My tablet fits with it perfect.  I also can set my phone on it.  Its Amazon brand and excellent quality for such a price.  The legs are adjustable and include padding.  Delivery was practically overnight with PRIME.  Thanks I do recommend.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Text: Love this stand. So much better than some of the other more expensive ones. This is very versatile. Use it mainly for my kindle Fire 10. Usually watch a show to fall asleep and this stand on my mattress handles all the moving around without the kindle toppling over.

Name: Caleb Hummel
Review Text: Iâ€™ve had this for a while now and used it plenty of times. Itâ€™s still holding up great. Weâ€™ve been pretty rough on it and itâ€™s still in great shape. It works great for propping up a tablet or hardback book, folds down compactly for easy travel and storage, and has held up well. I highly recommend it.

Name: Scal
Review Text: Nifty little folding stand with good adjustments for a wide range of angles.  Accommodates a large variety of devices and is fairly stable in both portrait and landscape modes with only a tiny bit of wobble.  Haven't used long term so can't comment on durability but it seems to be pretty tough plastic and the hinges seem beefy.  In terms of portability, yes it does fold into a 7" x 1" x 1" stick but it could probably be slimmed down even further with slightly less thick arms.  Overall pleased with purchase.

Name: Dr. Clive F. Jacks
Review Title: This plastic stand for holding tablets is just perfect..
Review Text: This plastic stand for holding tablets is just perfect ... and quite inexpensive!  It replaces one that I lost/misplaced, which turned out to be a blessing for I do like this one better than the one I had but misplaced/lost.  Oh, yeah - and this one I purchased for my son, to be one of my Christmas presents to him, one of the three that I purchased from/through "Amazon"!  This stand is well made, durable and could not have a better design.

Name: mofo83
Review Title: Excellent stand, especially for the price!
Review Text: Great stand! We bought one of these when it was made by Arkon, and have bought again after losing the first one on a plane.It holds the iPad securely, it's easy to find the right angle, it folds up into a compact size, and it's inexpensive. Perfect!The only slight negative is that the "teeth" that help the legs click into each position can wear down over time, so after a couple years they become sort of loose. And the foam that cushions the iPad does wear away. But these issues don't really effect the stability of the stand (somehow), so it's no big deal!Great buy overall.

Name: kathyjfla
Review Title: It does a great job of holding up my tablet!!
Review Text: I've been using this Tablet holder for a couple months now and I REALLY LIKE it!  It's lightweight yet holds my 10" tablet sturdily.  I also like the fact that I can easily fold it and take it with me, if I want.

Name: Alfonso
Review Text: Es un producto plÃ¡stico, se siente bastante firme en el manejo. Si se dobla y se desdobla constantemente el desgaste obviamente sera mucho antes de lo esperado.Si se mantiene en un lugar, sera un producto de una vida Ãºtil larga, detalles anti deslizantes en la parte de abajo y en la parte de arriba una capa fina de espuma suave donde se hace contacto con la tablet, lo cual me parece un buen detalle.

Name: ACE
Review Text: We have two of these stands and absolutely love them.One is used with a 2013 Nexus 7 tablet and Nokia Qi Wireless Charger. Search the internets on how to set this up because it is great. Honestly though wireless charging was an expensive joke until I tried it. It's so nice not messing with cables and plugs; I just hope the price comes down and the technology is standardized so I know my chargers will have some longevity.The other is used in the kitchen when we use the tablet for cooking and recipes.Very handy. Five stars.-ace

Name: Mail order fan
Review Text: This was money well spent: this stand can be positioned any way you would like, without interfering with controls. In addition it has a non-skid surface that prevents the device from sliding around in the stand. The bottom has a similar coating so the stand itself also stays firmly in place ,which is a problem with other stands, even if they do the multi-positioning well). It is sturdy and although I have not had any reason to do this yet, I would happily stick it in my disorganized purse without worrying about damaging it.Update - I had to take this down one star because the little rubber pads on the "leg" section let loose within a fairly short period of time. Still very happy with it though

Name: Teresa
Review Text: LOVE this item.  I reordered more of these to have around the house.  I use them to hold my ipad.  It is lightweight and adjustable.  I keep a thick lifeproof case on my ipad and the little stand that came with it kept breaking but the replacements were expensive. I ordered a different type that broke in a month.  Then I found this tablet stand.  I worried my cased ipad wouldn't fit in the grooves but it is perfect.  I also use it to hold clipboards with info.  LOVE LOVE LOVE this!

Name: The Artist
Review Text: A little more flimsy than I expected it to be. I'd actually describe it as rickety. Also, and I already knew this before I purchased it, there really is only one default position at 45 degrees. Yes, the arm adjusts to other angles, but your pad will sit rest on the tip of it.

Name: Charles Childers
Review Title: This is a great stand. It's a little thick
Review Text: This is a great stand. It's a little thick, but I keep one at home and one at the office. Easily adjustable, supports everything I've thrown at it (Kindle 4, Kindle Paperwhite, Kindle Fires in various sizes, iPad Mini, iPad Air 2). It allows a good range of angles, and is stable enough for use on most surfaces. Hard to go wrong with this.

Name: Robert Daniels
Review Title: I should have bought this years ago
Review Text: I have a Galaxy 6 inch tablet, and this stand works perfectly. You can adjust tilt, width (to accommodate larger tablets) and it folds away into a tiny form factor.

Name: Gene
Review Text: Durable and easy to use. Very flexible and can adjust to whatever angle you need. Light for traveling, sturdy plastic. Doesnâ€™t feel cheap at all. You canâ€™t beat the price!

Name: John M. Sklar
Review Text: This is a great table top music stand. Especially if your music is on an iPad or other tablet. Fits in my guitar case with a portable guitar stand too. Perfect!

Name: Cellar Troll
Review Title: You get what you pay for
Review Text: I needed a stand for my paper tablet. This one does not do the trick. The slightest interaction with my tablet causes the stand to wobble. Additionally, the feet arenâ€™t grippy, meaning the mount swivels on my desk when I interact with the tablet.

Name: S. Tyler
Review Title: Think no more. This is the one for you!!!!!!
Review Text: This is a great solution when you want to stand your tablet up in portrait mode.  I've got the i-BLASON Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 inch tablet Leather Case Cover:http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008L2WS8Q/ref=oh_details_o02_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1and this stand still works excellently with it, since the case only allows landscape viewing with its built-in stand.This is a very sturdy stand. I read reviews on a non-AmazanBasics stand where they said that one was flimsy. This one is definitely NOT flimsy.I don't think I can give enough positive reviews on this. Just buy it if you are even remotely considering it.

Name: Novafyre
Review Text: After propping up my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 against napkin holders, pillows, and yoga blocks, I finally bought this.  I wish I had bought it years ago.  It doesn't look like much, but it works like a champ.  I use it for reading, watching videos, and playing word games.  I was skeptical but the Kindle doesn't slip.  I cannot speak to its durability traveling yet.  It appears to fold up easily and fit back into its little case, but so far I have left it open so I really don't know if it would loosen up too much with a lot of opening and closing.

Name: Kindle Customer
Review Text: Perfect for my Nexus 7. Sits by the stereo and pumps sick jams. And I don't mean jam laced with some kind of horrible food borne pathogen. I mean "sick" like "awesome". Like how Michael Jackson used the word "Bad." I dunno if "ironic" is the right word, but that's kinda how I meant to use the word "sick." Anyway, I'm getting away from the fact that this is a super cheap, useful stand. You could also use it to prop up a small glossy photograph of Burt Reynolds.

Name: Ms. E. Rigby
Review Text: Perfect size fir my Amazon Fire Tablet.  Lightweight, portable, can throw it in my backpack or carry  it from room to room at home.  Very convenient and sturdy.

Name: KC
Review Title: Great engineering makes a great product
Review Text: Bought this for a portable monitor to keep next to my laptop. I love how it has a small footprint and allows for adjusting to multiple angles. I previously used a pricier rain design tablet stand and didn't like how the angle just wouldn't be vertical enough, plus it was heavier. Now I have the perfect angle with this adjustable tablet stand!

Name: Dred Steel
Review Title: works and easy to travel with
Review Text: I use this every day with the kids as they want to watch their tablets while eating.  It works!  No slipping. And it folds easily so that I can travel with it.

Name: Sassy
Review Text: This basic Stand was a spur of the moment purchase.  I figured at the low price and all the great reviews, I couldnt really go wrong.I am SO glad that I ordered this stand, actually ordered two of them.  I got one for myself to use with my iPad3 and one for my sons Nexus phone.  It works beautifully with both - I couldnt be happier.  I like how you can easily fold it up and put it away until the next use.  Its sturdy and well made.  Would most definately recommend this to friends and family!

Name: Don T.
Review Text: We bought this for my wife's 8x12 Samsung S7 tablet and it is so adjustable and so stable we are always impressed.  Whether in portrait or landscape position, her tablet is supported well.  When we use it for zoom get togethers it's easy to position so that the camera shows those who are present at our end.  When we're finished it folds up to be about 6"x 0.5" x 0.5"; very compact.  A worthwhile purchase.

Name: Virginia D. Carroll
Review Text: I love this little frame that ideally holds my Kindle at night while I read.  It is easy for me to change the page and I'm so glad I found this little gadget.

Name: ecb. K
Review Text: On a table, but not good for uneven surfaces or for portrait mode for any tracker taller than a fire 5I use it on my laptop when my better one is in use

Name: Geoff
Review Text: I use this as a holder for my tablet that I moved into the kitchen to be my permanent "cook book". This has made it far easier for us to look up recipes and follow them without needing to constantly unlock and dirty up our phones.

Name: D. W. Magee Jr.
Review Title: Perfect for holding Microsoft Surface in portrait mode
Review Text: I have a Microsoft Surface [RT], so I don't need something to prop it up in landscape mode. But I enjoy using the Surface in portrait mode for watching social-media feeds scroll past, so I tried this stand.Perfection! The stand elegantly holds my Surface--and, by placing the "top" (power-button side) on the left, I can easily charge the device and have clear access to the USB port. (For a Surface Pro or Surface Pro 2, putting the "top" on the right permits both charging (on the [now] bottom) and use of the USB port [on top].)And because the stand quickly and securely folds, I can haul it between home and work or toss it into my suitcase for travel.

Name: SHERRY
Review Text: Can be used for many devices.  I bought it to use to watch videos on fire in bed.  It is now in my kitchen.  It works well on hard services.  Movement on soft surfaces makes it fall off the grooves. I found different brand that I liked better but it is a good product, but, just not my favorite.

Name: KHM
Review Title: Great for FaceTiming- have had since 2014
Review Text: Iâ€™ve bought this twice and recommended it to multiple friends. Great for iPad for FaceTime and Zoom meetings. Holds well and you can angel it diff ways. Sturdy but doesnâ€™t take a lot of space. Bought it back in like 2014? And then again this year for parents. Still holds up well.

Name: melissa
Review Title: very sturdy, easy to view tablet
Review Text: this is perfect for watching amazon prime movies on my kindle fire. it holds the fire perfect. and it also hold my Iphone 10Xmax plus too. because the stand is adjustable.  i took this stand on a trip to OC maryland and watched movies in the hotel. its compact. fits it my purse. great little gadget

Name: Vanessa

I've been very happy with other Amazon products I have and this stand is no different.  Love Amazon products because they work great and the cost is low.

Review Title: Do not use with large tablets

The stand itself is small, light, and not very stable, so any pressure on the top left or right corners of you screen can cause the entire tablet to fall off the stand. I will be returning this product asap. Go for something a little more sturdy.

Review Text: This is the BEST product I bought for my 15.6 in portable monitor. The design is brilliant - I love how small it folds up! Easy to set up and fold back down.

Name: Peanut1964
Review Title: Uses less space than  some tablet stands
Review Text: I go through stands like most people go through underwear. Iâ€™ll get one I think Iâ€™ll like then when I go to use it Iâ€™m disappointed. This one fits my needs. Yes, it takes up a little bit of space on the desktop but it is adjustable and you can place your tablet in either landscape or portrait.

Name: Matt Sweeney
Review Title: Great product that I feel will break eventually
Review Text: I love this thing. It's supremely adjustable, doesn't slip, and feels solid. So why the three-star review? Because of the way you open and close the thing--it has these gear-like mechanisms that just rub against each other. Every time I open or close it, I feel like I could easily break it. I wish I could describe the problem better, but it's a case of "this much force will open the thing, slightly more feels like it will break it and render it useless." But, you can't really adjust how much force you use. You have to use enough to open it, right? But the force needed to open it feels like it will break it eventually.Sorry, this feels like the lamest review I've ever written.

Name: JimK
Review Title: This has very nice no-slip grips for the table surface and the device ...
Review Text: Small, simple, durable, and very adaptable.  I use this as a tabletop stand for my Kindle Reader, as reading on a couch or recliner seems to increase the gravitational pull on my eyelids.  This has very nice no-slip grips for the table surface and the device surface.  I need to place this on top of a book, though, if I want the charger cable connected while using this, so that there is room for the cable at the bottom... or change to a Landscape orientation.

Perfect,too, for watching while I cook, bake or whatever else I may be doing. It's easy to adjust and then stays where you put it. Best of all, it's inexpensive! Highly recommended!

Review Title: Sturdy, but not optimal for Kindle Keyboard
Review Text: There is nothing wrong with this product, but it is not optimally designed for the Kindle Keyboard, in my opinion.  Specifically, it doesn't seem designed to hold steady when pushing the page turn buttons on the sides.  The stand has two settings to adjust the spread of the legs for stability, but the wider setting is too wide to hold the Kindle. Setting the Kindle in the "landscape" position resolves this issue, but you have to get used to using the page-turn buttons in a different orientation.  Overall, well made product that is just shy of perfect for the Kindle Keyboard.  I'd still recommend it.

Name: reviewer
Review Title: EXACTLY THE SAME AS ARKON FOLD UP STAND
Review Text: I bought this fold up stand as well as an Arkon stand  that they are selling here on Amazon. They are EXACTLY THE SAME except one says Amazon and the other one says Arkon. Both black, both have the same patent number on the bottom and both say Taiwan. I paid $8.99 for Amazon stand and $12.99 for Arkon stand. The "upper arm" that goes behind your device has foam pads for traction and protection. The two "legs" have foam grips on the bottom  for traction and protects surfaces too. The distance between the notches when "legs" are opened all the way is approximately 3 1/2 -4 inches. The notches on the "legs" hold the bottom of your device and also has foam pads where the bottom front of your device will sit. Since the cut out only has foam pad on one side,  my tablet was sliding when i use it to read in bed. It should not be an issue if it is on a stable surface but i usually prop the stand on a pillow so it tends to move. I put some electrical tape on the slippery side to stop  it from moving. Seemed to help. The screw that holds the bend on the "arm" looks sturdy and holds my galaxy tab 10.1 without any problem so far. I like the product. It seems well made but they need to put pads on both sides of the notches so i dont have to modify it.

Review Title: Absolutely not the best choice for a tablet stand
Review Text: Absolutely not the best choice for a tablet stand. If you're looking to just have something to lean your tablet against, this is for you. If you're looking for a versatile, sturdy, balanced, stand, you may want to look at other options.

Name: SoFloMomma

Name: Nathan Casas
Review Title: This item almost broke my friendship

One day I let my friend borrow it for awhile and he didn't want to give it back. Provided him the link and told him to buy his own. Thank you Amazon Basics for showing my friends true colors.

Luckily I was able to locate all the parts and reassemble but I am not too optimistic about the long-term value of a product where the screws just pop out.

Review Text: I've used this stand with my "new" iPad for about three months with no problems. The product is all plastic except for a few small metal pins that hold it all together, but it is designed to be sturdy. The stand folds up to the size of a feet hot dog and unfolds into about 20 adjustable positions, so getting your tablet into an optimum position for upright use is a cinch. I have a Padlette (see my review) and this stand accommodates the iPad with the Padlette installed. Good goods.

Review Text: I use this stand with my Fire HD 7 installed in a Fintie case. It works great and is more rigid than the case, so bumping the table or desk or a gust of wind won't knock it over. It folds up to be quite compact. If you don't want a case but need the stand, for $12 this is the way to go. Works just as well, for me, with or without the case.

Name: Lee Rowley
Review Title: Handy, portable stand for my Kindle Fire
Review Text: I purchased this on the recommendation of a friend and boy am I happy I did! This little stand is perfect for my needs.It is a good size to hold my Fire but folds down into a small enough size that I can fit it into the pouch my daughter made for me to carry my Kindle. It is light weight but sturdy enough to hold my Fire safely. I use this in a variety of situations, using it to read while in a coffee shop, restaurant or working at my desk. I can have the Fire at the perfect angle for reading while I eat or when I am working at a desk. It also makes it easier to use the keyboard and for surfing the web as it has many possible positions for just about every situation.As a knitter, it is perfect for holding my Fire while I am knitting. I keep several knitting patterns that I am working on in my Fire and being able to prop it up makes it so much easier to use while knitting. I don't have to put my work down to check the pattern and don't lose my place as easily while using it.I have also used this at work to hold up hard copy while I work at my computer. I use a file folder and clip my copy to it and use the travel stand to hold my copy while I work with it. I often have to condense verbiage to put announcements and notices on my work blog. It is small and folds up so I can put it away when I am not using it. And it's less expensive than most copy holders that are big and bulky and get in the way when space is at a premium.I just love this product and will be purchasing a second one to keep at work. It's small, portable, versatile and really easy to use. It also functions as more than just a stand for my Fire. You can't go wrong with this product.

Name: M
Review Text: I'm not impressed with this tablet stand. I usually like the amazon basics brand because they're usually simple to manufacture, no frills items that are really inexpensive.The general function of the stand is really cool but the mechanical action is just a let down. When I first got it I tried to just unfold it but it was so flimsy and rigidly stuck in place I had to check the instructions because I thought I must be doing something wrong because I thought I was going to break it. There was nothing wrong except the way the stand splits open at the bottom. There are these little plastic nubs that hold it in position kind of like gears and they're like 1mm  high and made of cheap plastic. They are visibly scuffed or fused funny and I have opened it maybe 3 or 4 times. They wont last. Also most of the adjustments for the back part that holds the tablet up, do not sit flush with the back of the tablet. It's just kind of a flawed product design. I feel like I'm being harsh but it's true.My advice would be to get something else for a couple bucks more. There's an entire category for laptop stands on amazon and there are tablet stands within it. There are a lot of happy customers of this product so I may have just gotten one that slipped passed quality control. Good luck guys.

The product is a real surprise because of its price , design and simplicity . Very much part of the Apple way on the latter score. You do not have to spend 50 bucks or more for one of the metal stands. Definitely a good buy.

Review Title: Very Nice Product For My Samsung Galaxy Tab 2, 10.1
Review Text: This stand is higher quality than I expected.Anyone who has tried to stand up a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2, 10.1, or equivalent, knows it is difficult.This stand takes that problem out of the equation. It works well, in portrait or landscape mode, is completely adjustable for angle, and even has enough clearance, to plug in the charging cord. It would, and does, work just as well with other sizes, like my 7" Kindle Fire HD.It folds up small, with no sharp corners, and tucks away easily in my small tablet attache.The ratcheting mechanism is  coarse enough, that it should last for a long time. It is also very stable, with no worries about it folding up while in use.This is one, of several, attachments/appliances that you should buy when you make the original purchase of a tablet computer.I highly recommend this product to friends, and you should too.

Name: Matt
Review Text: I've been in the market for a tablet stand for a while, and when I saw this one from AmazonBasics and the large number of positive reviews I decided to purchase it the last time I ordered. However, I was quite disappointed at the quality of the stand once I received it. The stand is made of plastic, not metal. It keeps the weight down, and it is a thicker plastic, but it is still plastic. it features anti-slip material on the bottom of the feet and on the underside top half of the arm, but it is foam, not rubber, so durability is an issue, especially if it is taken in and out of bags. it does not have any padding on the tip of the arm, so if you want your tablet sitting more upright than what is shown in the display picture for this tablet, it will be resting against hard plastic. The legs do not spread wider than the display picture shows, so those of us with larger tablets (I have an 11.6" MSI W30 purchased here on Amazon) may find stability is an issue when used in landscape mode.All in all it's an alright stand, but it's a $4 stand, not the $9 Amazon asks.

Review Text: I wasn't as impressed with this stand as I have been with other Amazon Basics items. The construction of the stand itself is fine, but the design is lacking. When used with an iPad, it seems rocky and not secure. Plus, it is hard to find a good enough tilt on the back arm. If it isn't set just right, the iPad will push it backwards when you tap. I think that the problem lies with the pads on the bottom. It lacks a full pad under the hinge on the rear, so of course, the natural tendency is to tilt backwards. That is the opposite of the desired behavior of a stand like this.Overall, it does its job, and it is OK for the price, but I bet that there are much better ones out there.

Name: PAPASTAG
Review Text: Perfect little piece of plastic!  It holds my tablet exactly where I want it, in whatever position I want it, and then stays out of the way.  It's really an overlooked quality that I wish more manufacturers would embrace - doing a job without overwhelming or overdoing whatever it is that it's supposed be doing.  If I wanted an art deco piece to compliment my decor, I would have bought that. When I want a stand to hold my tablet up so I can see my *tablet* I don't want to be looking at the stand it's on.  When you look at my attached photo, what do you see? The tablet! Just like you're supposed to.It's lightweight, sturdy, cheap, and does EXACTLY what it's supposed to and nothing more.  Bravo Amazon, Bravo.

Review Title: Cheaply made, wobbly and uneven product.
Review Text: Very cheap quality item.  Wobbly, uneven and barely supports an iPad Air.  I can't imagine it holding anything heavier as the rear support backing just about didn't have enough strength to hold an iPad Air.  Returned this and bought an Anker Multi angle stand.  MUCH happier with that stand!  It is much sturdier, holds up to 11 lbs, and actually has a locking button to keep the stand at the angle you want it. Not to mention Staples has them for cheaper than Amazon. Again, bottom line, avoid the cheaply made Amazon Basics products.  Spend a few more dollars and get a good quality, name brand product.  You won't be disappointed.

Name: Nathan Romanic
Review Text: This stand is alright but it's a little unstable, even on the flatest of surfaces, at certain angles with an item as large/heavy as an iPad.  The iPad isn't going to fall to the side with standard tapping or anything, but I just didn't feel comfortable leaving it on the stand for fear that the table might be bumped and the iPad might fall.  For very little difference in price I much prefer Anker's multi-angle stand. Very substantial in comparison to the AmazonBasics stand. So while this stand does it's job, and therefore doesn't warrant 1 or 2 stars, there are better options available. As always, Amazon was amazing regarding this transaction. I attempted to return the stand and Amazon gave a refund and said go ahead and keep the stand, no need to return it. Saves me a trip to the UPS store.

Name: Phaeton
Review Title: Very First Letdown by an Amazon Basics Product
Review Text: Amazon Basics products are consistently well-made and efficient. This is the first one that has disappointed me. I needed a stand for a 13" Azpen (also a disappointment) and this seemed to fit the bill; it does not. It does not sit securely without wobbling. It does manage the weight of the tablet but will not hold a position that keeps it upright enough for clear viewing. I have adjusted it multiple times and have even tried to use it backwards to no avail. I actually feel bad about knocking an Amazon product but I feel that I would not be doing them any favors by not pointing out these flaws.

Name: Robert D.
Review Text: You know when you buy something on impulse knowing that you don't really need it but it's so inexpensive you don't really mind if you never really use it or if it just doesn't work well? That's exactly the tough I had when I ordered this tablet stand. However, the result of the whimsical purchase was a pleasant surprise. Not only does the stand work well, even for my large 10.5" Samsung Tab S, I now rely on it every day. It serves as a second screen in my office which streams news or acts as a notepad or runs apps not available on desktops. It acts as my recipe book stand when cooking. It even converts my tablet into a bedside clock radio and info center. Seriously, I've bought mobile and computer accessories at 5x the cost only to use them a hand full of times. Sometimes the simplest things are best surprises.

Name: Samuel Eubank
Review Title: I purchased three stands for a Samsung Note 2, ...
Review Text: I purchased three stands for a Samsung Note 2, a Kindle Fire HD and an iPad Mini for the purpose of mobile app development. The stands are light and flimsy, so they don't keep a device in place while using a touchscreen. Also, they don't leave enough room at the bottom for a cable to be plugged in while a tablet or large smartphone that has a bottom plug (as many do) is in portrait orientation. This causes the stand to wobble to the left and right. The legs also have fixed positions which are not ideal for a large phone or small tablet.If I was using a regular size tablet and didn't need to plug it in, this stand might work for me, but that's not the case.

Name: Peter L. Simons
Review Title: 1" and would like to add some clarification and an update
Review Text: I wrote a previous review about the Kindle Fire HD 10.1" and would like to add some clarification and an update.  Here's the point:  It's not whether or not you can get your Gmail contacts into this device.  Yes you can... sort of. Some of my contacts were missing for no reason I could figure out, and I could not import my groups.  Yes I could go to contacts.gmail.com and get my contacts and groups from there, but there's no way to send an email from that location.Here's the bottom line:  I went to Costco and purchased a Galaxy Tab A 9.7 for $40 more than I paid for the Kindle Fire HD 10".  Boy, what a difference. Syncing up to my existing Gmail stuff, including contacts, was so easy it feels like cheating.  Everything else is easier too.  Do yourself a big favor, spend the extra $40 and get the Samsung.  It's head and shoulders above the Kindle.  Don't get me wrong, I will continue to be a faithful Amazon supporter, and getting a lot of use out of Amazon Prime, but the Kindle simply doesn't cut it.

Name: Doris Tan
Review Text: The stand is bulky but it is light  in weight. I find it not the money worth. Especially with the added postage.

Name: Michael Richards
Review Title: Best F'ing thing under $10 I have ever bought on Amazon!
Review Text: Best F'ing thing under 10 dollars I have ever bought on Amazon! No, I'm serious. I'd give it a 20 on versatility alone. I got tired of propping up my tablet on a pillow or whatever else was laying around, so I thought for $10, "let's try this, it looks simple and folds up nice, so it'd be good to go on a trip." So I get the thing, and it's well built and sturdy, but I didn't really appreciate the engineering until I started to use it. The combination of two hinges and the v-shaped adjustable base means you can come up with a pleasantly bewildering variety of positions you can put this thing in. I modified mine slightly with Velcro to allow it to attach to some other things I have that are Velcro'd. And not only does it seem to fit every situation and position: hanging; standing sideways; upside down; and in the two or three positions I was expecting it to, it turns out that it acts as a cord detangler and small cable management system and can hold two or three different things all at the same time. Seriously the engineering that went into this little thing is amazing. Because somebody calculated all of those angles and how those hinges should work and it is just well done. I usually find engineers over-engineer stuff, and with the exception of bridges, buildings and aircraft, I don't really want them to be involved in most things. But this is an example of engineering done right. So whatever team of engineers, or if possible, a single engineer, designed this gets an "attaboy" and then some. I'll buy you a beer if you're ever in Florida. I will probably be buying several more of these to use for other unexpected things. If you're getting ready to order one, go ahead and make it three and see where else you can use it, because it's crazy useful.

Name: Bernard Dale
Review Text: I do not use a stand on a flat surface but being in my 80's, need to use it from a lounge chair with rounded arms. I therefore hoped the supportive section would swivel on the base. Unfortunately it doesn't  so that I cannot use it.
